But the next time I go to use it I get an error and twice now everything on this has been deleted! Luckily I still have the stuff to back up again but the whole point of having this story just so I can delete it off my computer to save space. I'm using a Samsung Galaxy Note 9, a Samsung Galaxy Tab S4, and an HP Spectre 360 Gem cut Edition.. so all my devices are top-of-the-line and I don't have this issue with any other flash drives or backup storage devices at all! Problem is I don't have any faith in this thing now because I've lost everything on it not once but twice. And that defeats the whole purpose. I feel like I threw $100 out of the window
title: No good at all!! Lost EVERYTHING twice!!

author: MA Stewart
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2019
review_content: For several years Seagate drives were among the worst in the industry. Their failure rate was much higher than Western Digital, and others. However, the company seemed to be improving things in the past couple of years, receiving high marks from several QC testing sites. Based on this I bought a couple of their Back Up Plus units and was pretty impressed. Then I tried this model, and it pretty much sucks. The first unit had issues mounting, and was unbearably loud. The first time I attempted to transfer a large chunk of data it locked up completely--less than a week after receiving the new unit. Amazon quickly replaced this unit with a similar one. So far, after a week, it seems to run OK, but, again, is unbearably loud. I can't work at my computer it's so loud. And, generally, a loud HD means it's gonna fail soon--so to hell with this lousy Seagate drive, I'm going back to WD.
title: Seagate quality still unreliable

author: Louis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2020
review_content: There is some confusion on whether this will work for a PS4 and I wanted to hopefully clear that up. I bought it under the impression that it would, but when I plugged it in and tried to format, my playstation said it would not work for a few reasons I was fairly certain were not the case. Others have said it worked immediately; my PS4 is one of the earlier models so that may be a factor.If you are getting a message saying it will not work because it needs to be a usb3.0 device (it is), needs to have between 250mb and 8tb (it does), or another unintelligible error message (possibly true), the drive needs formatted as exFat (I am not sure what this means).You will need a computer to do this, but it can be done with either a mac or pc.Mac: Connect the thumb drive to your Mac. Launch Disk Utility: press Command+Space then type: disk utility. Select your drive in the Disk Utility window then click the Erase tab. In the Format list box select ExFAT, enter a Volume Label if you want, then click Erase.PC: could vary based on windows version, but for 7/8/10 Connect the external hard drive to your computer and make sure that it can be detected by Windows.2. Press Windows + X at the same time and choose “Disk Management”.3. Right click the hard drive partition that you intend to format to exFAT and choose “Delete Volume” to delete the partition.4. Right click the unallocated disk space and choose “New simple volume” and do as the prompts.5. In the Format Partition window, set the file system as exFAT and click “Next”>“Finish” to start the operation.Hope this helps anyones frustration or stops someone from throwing it in the trash.
title: Will work with PS4

author: Michael J. Klein
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2020
review_content: Primary reason I purchased this drive was the price per capacity. I accidentally dropped my 4TB drive and wiped it out (arggg!). I possess several multi-TB drives now and need to have backups/disk images. Replacing the other with this capacity makes that possible. My experience with Seagate drives has been superb, so choosing that was a no-brainer. Having just used it to image a 3TB disk left me with a positive appreciation of speed and performance. I hope it lives up to my past experiences.
title: Backup drive - Seagate Desktop 8TB External HDD (STGY8000400)

author: boss2688
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2020
review_content: Contains Seagate 16TB HDD Exos X16 ST16000NM001G, the only difference from retail is it only has a 3 year warranty instead of 5.
title: Great value 16tb drive

author: David Lucas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2020
review_content: If Amazon is going to sell the item as new it should come in the original packing from seagate. You don’t know if it’s been customer returned or refurbished. New to me is 100% Original packaging.  If I didn’t need this for a business deal. I would have returned.  Amazon needs to says they repackaged it on the items description.
title: Item description misleading

author: Loryn L.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2020
review_content: I wish I would've read more reviews before purchasing this. The person who said the write speed is extremely slow was correct. As I am backing up some files to the otherwise empty drive, the write speed hardly ever goes over 2mb/s. It is a large drive for a great price however, and I will only be using it to occasionally back up my laptop, so it will work for me, but definitely not for someone who wants to use it more than once a month.
title: Extremely slow

author: Hito
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020
review_content: Great storage solution for the price but it's slow.  Transferring files to it via usb goes at 25-28MB/s copy/paste and cut/paste at 155MB/s.  This is a 5400rpm drive.To the people reporting drive failure it may be due to how it is shipped.  It's pretty much in a retail box and that what its shipped in... cardboard with a cardboard brace holding the product.  As you know plates don'tike being knocked around.  Better shipping packaging would resolve some of that issue.That being said, it's a nice drive for the price, good for storage.  I have no problem watching media off of it.  And so far have zero issues and have transferred about 2TB of data onto the 8TB drive.
title: Good for the money

author: M2
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2019
review_content: Just installed 2TB version to replace 500GB drive in my Tivo Bolt.  Keep in mind for those that don't know(to the best of my knowledge) Tivo only supports old models of esata hard drives of specific models).  This is a USB3 model that I disassembled and removed the drive to install in my Tivo Bolt.  I am not running Hydra but otherwise running latest software as of 2/2019.  Installed the new drive and booted Tivo without issue.  The Tivo Bolt will boot with this as a blank drive and install the OS on it's own.  Just as an FYI after prying the external enclosure apart the internal drive model is ST2000LM007.I still find it odd that drives in enclosures are less expensive that the bare drive.  But anyway this was much less expensive that purchasing a more expensive Tivo with a larger drive.  Tivo is still the best DVR.  Sad that I think we will see it go away as streaming is taking over.  I currently have satellite TV but am going to use this for OTA for local channels and streaming for the rest then drop satellite.  Hope someone finds this useful.
title: Just installed in Tivo Bolt Works Great (by disassembling the Tivo Bolt of course)

author: Edsel.CM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020
review_content: I decided to go DIGITAL COPY ONLY in my xbox one x gaming environment.  Since I did note have many games to begin with, I thought it proper to purchase this 8TB external hard drive for my Xbox One X.  I have some noob friends that think they're elite with their inferior 1TB external hard drives to store digital copies of games. When I screenshoted my xbox's storage external hard drive storage capacity, my noob friends shut their noob mouths!In my opinion, this was a excellent purchase to store digital copies of the games I purchased. I no longer have to change gaming media should I wish to play a different game on my xbox one x.
title: A definite MUST HAVE if you're using it for your xbox one x

author: Meg Helmes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
review_content: Bought this to archive large video and audio files. Right out of the box, the write speed felt brutally slow. Moving files onto it took hours longer than it did with other external drives (using the same USB ports, etc). Once it was under heavy use, it started to fail, making loud thumping sounds and choking on fast downloads -- all downloads would lock up and fail. Through trial and error I figured out it was not my internet connection, but the hard drive that was causing this. Shortly after that it started giving me "The request could not be performed because of an I/O device error" messages. Not good Bob!Because it took me a couple weeks to start my archiving project, then another couple for it to fail, I'm outside the return window. I also needed to buy another drive of the same size to transfer all the files that were already on this soon-to-be-dead drive. The Western Digital I got? Cost less, smoother, quieter, faster.But now I'm out several hours of retransferring the files, plus time spent writing zeros to this drive before I return it. And I'll have to deal with warranty since I can't just return it -- but of course, I don't want another Seagate drive, since I don't need two of these to begin with, and I certainly don't want to use Seagate for my storage after this experience. I should have gone with WD in the first place.
title: Slow and clunky even before it died

author: Christine H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2020
review_content: I have a MacBook Air with 128GB storage and used to have a second laptop with more storage capacity that held all my photos (tons of them) and music files, among others. Now I use this little external drive instead and it works seamlessly.
title: Lets me save all the files I can't fit on my MacBook Air

author: Kris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2020
review_content: Am in the process of sending my drive into get it replaced under warranty and seeing if they can retrieve the ~8TB of data that is on it.  I have this drive sitting on my desk connected to the USB port and power strip and it started beeping about 2 weeks after I received it.  I am hopeful that the data can be restored as I had not had a chance to back up the data I had moved to the new drive.Not happy to have this drive go back after less than 1 month of use.On a brighter note, of sorts, I have sprung for a NAS and will be updating my storage to use this as my main storage + backup.
title: Drive started beeping 2 weeks after purchase

author: Alex K
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2020
review_content: Like all of the Seagate external hard drives that I've had, this one functions flawlessly. Plug and play. Like the others, I'll probably just forget about it until I swap it out for an even bigger drive in a few years. Height and width are approximately the size of a pack of cigarettes but significantly thinner. Same size and price as my older 2 TB drive. Runs silently.
title: All pros and no cons

author: J. Urso
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2019
review_content: Was successful in getting this to work with PS4 with a few extra steps. Initially when I plugged in the to the USB port and attempted to format as extended storage it did not work — have a ps error code . Tried rebooting and still no luck.  Ultimately, I needed to plug the drive into my laptop, delete the partition, reformat as fat32 and then try again with ps4.  Ps4 then recognized the drive and allowed me to format as extended storage. Now works great.  Deducted one star for the extra effort that is likely not very intuitive for most.  Ultimately happy with the purchase. Good price and performance.
title: Works with PS4 after deleting partition

author: Pewsplosions
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2020
review_content: Recently while building in a tiny Pi NAS case I realized that only 2TB 2.5" drives or smaller would fit due to the width. But I thought I'd try these anyway. Got 1 inside and 1 outside the case. Both were disassembled and the inner drive is just a plain sata drive. So that was nice. No extra steps, just removed the case and done. I was planning a 20TB nas, then thought I was stuck with an 8TB nas then managed to squeeze out 16TB thanks to these. Pretty happy w/ the build now.Been running one for a few months now with no problems. Seem like pretty good drives to me.
title: 5TB shuck'd x2 for tiny NAS

author: Jeffery Scott
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
review_content: I've used the drive for one day and it is working well. I have other Seagate drives and they have all been reliable.  I use them for backup.  I expect this will work fine as well.  The only issue I have is with the description of this as a 5 T drive.  That is only true if you are using base 10 (so 1K is 1,000 bytes, 1MG is 1,000 K, 1 GB is 1,000 MG, and 1 T is 1,000 GB).  Computers count using binary (so 1K is 1024 (2 to the tenth power) bytes, 1 MG is 1024 K, 1 GB is 1024 MG, and 1 T is 1024 GB.  So this drive is not really as big as I was expecting.  Using 1000 as a multiplier instead of 1024 is a bit deceptive.
title: It is only 4.5 T

author: Richard Moseley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020
review_content: I read the review, most of the negative reviews said it is slow. Reading from my server which in itself is not fast, but faster than this drive. I copied 5.70 TB (6,268,564,116,782 bytes) consisting of 1,212,515 Files, 12,640 Folders. While my 40TB server can completely format and reconstruct 40TB in 5 days this 5.7TB data took 8 1/2 days to write. My MP4 files could play back adequately on the computer, I have not tried a TV interface. Moving 13GB back off of this drive was not blazing but better that the initial write speed. So Write speed is much slower that Read speed.  I did find several folders and some files in my folders were missing from a block copy command. I do not know if it was the computer or the drive causing this drop out. I used a free application called "Pathsync" following the initial identification of missing files, and was able to achieve a byte to byte copy of these files.  For critical files that may need to be transported, this drive is acceptable to me.
title: Yes it is SLOW Writing, But it stores the data.

author: Barbara A.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2020
review_content: Just received my drive today. It was super easy to set up. Just plugged it in and was good to go. Disappointed it didn't come with backup software.If you click on the Start_Here icon for Windows, it takes you to their web page where you can register your warranty. HOWEVER, watch out! One is asked to agree to their terms and conditions, privacy policy and optional offers. I had to do some digging in the privacy statement, and discovered that basically you are agreeing to be tracked by dozens of companies across the internet. You have to dig further to find the opt out button. I tried it, but after several minutes of waiting, it wouldn't let me proceed. I am guessing that's because I already have a bunch of privacy protections on my internet browser, and they wanted my cookies turned on. No, thanks.  I decided not to even register for the warranty. This level of invasion of privacy is UNACCEPTABLE when I have paid to purchase this product.
title: So far so good, but watch your privacy

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020
review_content: I ordered this product because it says in the product name that it works with Macs. Upon plugging it into the computer, it allowed me to register the product but then I could go no further because it said it was only designed for PC’s. Very disappointing to get this far with something that’s mis-labeled and to have to return it to buy something else. Will not be purchasing again.
title: Does not work with Macs

author: Duncan Christopher McNew
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2020
review_content: purchased this February 26th. It died the evening of April 14th…just after the return window, of course.As soon as I opened the package upon arrival I had a feeling this thing was cheap plastic crap. It felt flimsy and light. The case easily warped when I grasped it. Then I plugged it in and started transferring some files and set it up for Time Machine backups and I noticed that the speed was pretty slow, too, even over Thunderbolt3. I just did not trust this drive for anything more than a redundant backup.It went nowhere; never travelled with me. It just sat on the desk being a backup for my current—but full—backup drive. Then this evening I planned on reviewing some tax documents I had saved on it and it wouldn’t even mount. Just a popup telling me the drive was unable to be located. And every few seconds a screeching whine shot out of it that I can only assume was head crash.What a complete waste of $90. I mean, I never intended this thing to store anything truly important or to be my only backup, but really… seven weeks?! And it didn’t even move from the desk?! For crying out loud, you’d think I was using the thing for batting practice with how catastrophically it had failed.Possibly a one-in-a-million dud. Many other reviewers love this drive; not me. This experience has certainly tilted me to strongly consider an SSD at this point for nothing more than the potential of better reliability, because that’s kinda the most important attribute in a backup drive.
title: his is an update after a couple months later from buying it.

author: Bri
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2020
review_content: Works for iMac. I plugged it in and did NOT register or use the built in seagate Mac user setup that wants your name, address, etc, but rather I used the the iMacs disk utility to ERASE. I got an error and a grayed out disk3s2 drive instead of Seagate 8TB as it was upon install. It would not let me mount it either. I ran ERASE AGAIN and it worked perfectly. I selected plain APFS and renamed the drive. Saved 82 GB to it that I had already on the new iMac and it saved very quickly plugged directly into USB in back of iMac. Be aware that if you use a USB 2.0 dongle it will not write as quickly. Make sure to plug this in directly to Mac or use 3.0 dongle.
title: Works for iMac, read my comment

author: Supreme Overlord of the Earth (aka Jon)
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2020
review_content: I got this just for the inner drive. I am happy to say that it is shuck-able and there are no "gotchas". Use a spugger to open the outer case and a Phillips for a couple of screws. That's it. You can even replace it with one of your own drives.In operation it is rather noisy but other than that, it works in my Synology NAS just fine (at least so far).
title: Shuckable

author: Douglas F. Mitchell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020
review_content: About 4.5 TB of 5 are available for use.  It was just "plug and play" as I plugged in the USB connector.  It came up for use as an external storage device immediately and worked like a regular storage drive right off the bat.  I copied over 16,000 jpeg pictures (from an older computer running Windows Vista) in about 1hr 20 min if I remember correctly.  Now I have plenty of storage for more pictures (and I have a lot more) and some video.
title: Super easy to use !!!  Excellent product !!!

author: cakhuxel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020
review_content: I would like to make sure that everyone knows that this is NOT for a Mac.  And even though it clearly says MAC in the description, and it is sold by Amazon and not a hinky third party dealer, the Seagate company will NOT replace or help in any way.  Good Luck.
title: NOT FOR MAC

author: JSmith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020
review_content: I love this because I work from a work laptop but also keep the client stuff from my 1099 law firm gig and my personal consulting law firm on the laptop. I’d lose all that if the employment project ended and I had to return the laptop. Not anymore! It only took five minutes to transfer 18 months of three business ventures from the laptop to the external hard drive. I suppose I’ll do it again at the end of each quarter or six months or annually or upon return of the laptop, which will allow me to keep all the work product. I’d never done this before and I think - what a beautiful preservation and insurance policy! Normally the stuff I don’t email to myself gets lost when I switch gears. It’s small too. Very convenient.
title: Preserves ownership of work product on separately owned laptop

author: Korinne Luchies
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2020
review_content: I was very happy with this hard drive! Fast enough for me, worked well and great storage. However while uploading to it I had it sitting on an end table. I checked my progress and just barely caught the cord as I walked away. It dropped 18-24 inches, pulled free from the cord on the way down and fell. I soon realized that little fall had ended this hard drive for good. Quite a hassle and disappointment! I'm obviously at fault but sad at just how easy it was to crash this and loose all my files(thankfully backed up but a hassle to get them all together again, replace the hard drive, ECT.).
title: Fell 18 inches while plugged in and died

author: Rafael
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020
review_content: I wanted to wait until a couple of months using this product before make a legit an fair review... And honestly I want to say that this product is AMAZING. Ususally when I use portable devices if I'm transfering data and by accident I move my pc just 1 inch the data transfering stop inmediatly or the pc send me an Error code. This device and the cable are very strong and the transfering data process is very fast and reliable. What i LOVE of this external portable Hard Drive what is that no matter if I move the pc accidentally or literally I grab it during the data transfering process it still working perfectly. My Hard Drive felt a couple of time from my desk or bed to the ground and it still working perfectly.Right now is cyberg monday and I just ordered a second one for my girlfriend, if you want a GOOD and Reliable 1 Terabyte external hard drive for less than $50 stop your search this is the one. 100% recommended.
title: Great and fast performance, strong hardware and very reliable transfering data.

author: Azphxguy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2020
review_content: This little drive works great. Fast read/write speeds, it's light and small enough to fit in my pocket when traveling with my laptop. It can also fit nicely into my laptop's case in a small pouch. The capacity is great. I'm very happy with this and will be buying a few more.
title: Great, small form factor, big storage

author: Angel101
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2020
review_content: I bought this 2 days ago and used it for a mac pro laptop. Not only did it take FOREVER to transfer files from the USB only cable but then after 15 hours it got an error message and it was a LOST. So i thought, okay I'll start over again. My computer wouldn't even recognize it on the laptop after that. I returned it today and going to invest more money in something more reliable and NOT made in Thailand. There was NO customer service.
title: Slow and Failed

author: Cuffy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2020
review_content: One MUST back-up all your data files of every type.  This Seagate is my second expansion by them and is very simple to use, basically drag and drop.  Windows 10 has made finding updated files in your main computer harder to find and copy, but otherwise the backup procedure is like muscle memory.  My first unit lasted eight years and then died suddenly for no known reason.  So now I double back-up ... to the Seagate, which is quick and simple, and portable, and then to a number of flash drives requiring no power or having moving drives.  I take this expansion as a duplication of my main PC when I go elsewhere and it's the same as having the home PC with me.  Works great with my laptop.
title: Absolute necessity

author: KingCorey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2020
review_content: With the transition to the next generation of consoles everyone should want to back up their digital games. I bought this a few months back to hold my digital collection and archive of free PS Plus games. Load times are amazingly fast while I game on my PS4 Pro. I hear that the yet to be released PS5 will be compatible with digital storage alike, And with this being announced they'r destined to go quick. Be sure to completely power down your console when your finished gaming (unless you have something down loading while your system is in rest mode) because the drive will stay on as you can tell my the light flash and light vibrations from the inner machine. Storage and portability are definitely a plus. Other than that It's a great piece of hardware totally worth the investment especially for gamers. It's a must grab.
title: Great product. Get it while you can!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2020
review_content: I purchased this for use with the new MacBook Air Laptop I was given for work (I am a PC girl, not a Mac by anyway you look at it).  I thought that when I purchased this that it was going to have US-C adapter as that is what our Mac's are..... instead it is USB.  It was really easy to set up, once we figured out the dongle needed to have the computers power cord attached to it, to have enough power to run the portable hard-drive.I have just had my business agent purchase 5 more, with 5 of the US-C adapters so that we can plug directly to the computer and bypass the dongle, so that we have the space to download our Zoom/Meets Recordings and Course Assignment Recordings.
title: Using for MacBook Air for work

author: Duy D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020
review_content: USED Seagate (STGY8000400) Desktop 8TB External Hard Drive HDDOn initial use, I clocked 25MB/s write speed. That is 1/4 or 1/6 the speed of all my other USB 3.0 drives. I saw the top review and thought I got lemoned. I went through all the troubleshooting steps I could find online and the solution was Seagate's software update. I suspect the product's firmware was rolled back prior to resell.UPDATEFor unknown reasons, speed will drop back down to 25MB/s, and other times it will run at normal speeds. When I have large data to transfer, I just restart my computer and hope for normals speeds. Minus 2 stars for the random inconvenience.
title: Speed as advertised SOMETIMES after UPDATE

author: Seumas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2020
review_content: I started running out of storage space on my pc, and a friend of mine suggested an external hard drive.  So, I bought this one, and I am amazed at the storage capacity.  I won't have any more problems with storage now.  The one problem I have is that it's not as portable as I'd like it to be.  It's a little bit smaller than some of the smart phones out there, so if you're  traveling it would be best to keep it in a suitcase or some other secure storage container.  I do like that it comes with a USB cable that you can use to plug it right into your desktop.  And one more thing: When transferring files from your desktop to the external hard drive, it can take anywhere from 15-45 minutes to move the files, depending on how many files you move at one time.
title: Loads of storage capacity!

author: Jim Cheshier
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2019
review_content: The Seagate 1TB external hard drive did work with my Nvidia Shield TV. However, when I installed it, I got a message indicating that the device seemed slow. I have a couple of games on my Shield TV that I play regularly, these did ,in fact, perform sluggishly and with some stutter. The Western Digital hdd that I was replacing never demonstrated the lag and stutter to that degree. Ultimately, I chose to return this HDD and will consider a SSD.
title: Read/write seem too slow to work with an Nvidia Shield TV, at least for gaming.

author: Warren
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2020
review_content: At first I had a problem with the drive going to sleep and not waking up and my computer freezing up. Then I figured out that it was not the drive doing this but it was my computers default settings causing the problem so I changed the settings. I had to turn off the setting that shuts down the hard drive and the setting that shuts down my usb port after an extended amount of time. Once I changed those settings I have not had any problems with the drive. They should add how to do that in the tech support because I almost sent the drive back thinking there was a problem with the drive. So just go into device manager and select universal serial bus controller then select your usb hub (right click) and select properties and under power management untick where it says allow computer to turn off this device to save power. Then go into power settings and select advanced power settings and under hard drive where it says turn off hard drive select never. My hard drive functions perfectly after doing these things so it should work for you as well.
title: drive would not wake up after falling asleep, here is the fix.

author: S. Gilbert
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2018
review_content: Works great and requires no external power adapter. Obtains power through USB port. No issues so far using as a DVR with the Dish Wally receiver. Previous 1TB Toshiba HD did not work with Wally even after reformatting on my laptop first, as suggested by other users. The Seagate was literally plug n play.
title: Works with Wally Receiver!

author: Aundrey Azeez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020
review_content: The size of this was small and looked truly portable. I tried this on a number of computers with Windows 8 and 10. My screen went blank on all three computers I used this on and would not return to desktop. I eventually had to do hard shut down on all three computers and remove the device as it wouldn't allow me to safely remove when I tried it in safe mode. Fortunately, my computers still seem to be functional without this external hard drive. I don't know if I got a dud, but I am disappointed in Seagate because their products had always been top notch before this hard drive.
title: Highly Disappointed.😞

author: eddie lizzard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2020
review_content: Wanted to add memory to ps4 pro ,1. Plug in usb cord2. Plug in drive to usb cord3. Turn on ps4 and let it find it.It will ask if you want to format it (yes)... you're done.You can now move around games between drives.I haven't got round to loading anything but everything I've seen suggests it's flawless too.
title: Flawless connectivity to ps4

author: C&J
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2020
review_content: Given as a gift to someone who needed additional storage for games on their xbox one. It worked perfectly, we plugged it in and restarted the xbox as instructed, and like magic additional storage appeared, ready for downloads.Can’t rate on whether it’s portable, since it stays on the shelf permanently. You do need to leave it plugged in to use, with the provided cable which is rather short. It’s so light, I’d be afraid of damaging it if you used this as additional storage to something portable like a laptop. Doesn’t feel like it could take a beating, but I haven’t tried.Overall pleased with the purchase. Works as intended, for extra storage on an xbox one.
title: Works perfect for xbox one

author: M. Ryan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2020
review_content: While using this drive is fine for most day to day backup tasks, if you have a very large data set to backup you likely will be waiting a LONG time for it to do the initial backup. It took me over 50 hours (yeah, 2+ days!) to copy 4TB of data to this drive from a full drive I was replacing. After the initial few hours, the transfer rate fell to 10-20MB/s and stayed there until the copy completed.In all cases that I've tried, the read speed of this drive is just fine for an external disk. (180-220MB/s for large files/sequential data)Note: that is TYPICAL for SMR drives. I just never knew this was an SMR drive until after I had purchased.
title: SLOW (very very slow) writes drive under certain workloads. SMR drive.

author: s66
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2020
review_content: it's nice 16T, but need some serious improvement1) sequential read/write seems to be pretty quiet, but random seeking read/write is very loud and vibrate ("thump... thump... thump"), I have gone through 3 copies all doing the same thing. I also have a WD element 14TB drive, it's MUCH quieter and smoother. Given that random seek vibration I don't know how long these drives will last, no confidence2) should be better packaged, amazon ship them only in bubbled envelop, it's crazy, as you can imagine it will be tossed around during shipping, and seagate's own box protection is too slim, they need to make it so when dropping from a few feet won't damage the drive, it makes no sense to have all the best tech then failed to transport to consumers in perfect condition
title: random seek is loud and vibrate, also need better packaging

author: david westmeier
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2020
review_content: This Seagate external hard drive seemed reasonably priced, so I bought one. It was my first and last Seagate purchase. Dismayed when I opened the package to find Seagate apparently does not offer an opportunity to add a password for security, I phoned the company.  My call was answered by someone whom I couldn’t understand, so I requested a different agent. My call was immediately disconnected. Next, I tried texting, and learned that I must purchase a file lock in order to protect my files. Purchasing a file lock would raise the total purchase price by an additional $32. So I’m going to send it back. What use is an external drive that cannot be secured, and why does Samsung refuse to include password protection? The person with whom I engaged in the texting had no answer other than “look on the web for third party software sir”. Forget Seagate. It’s a total rip off.
title: No security feature, poor

author: Michael C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2020
review_content: This thing is a massive 10Tb drive. I own a photography studio and backups, especially in redundancy are key. I have 4 smaller backup drives now all backed up again onto this drive. Fast transfer speed through USB 3.0. Great purchase.
title: Massive little drive.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2020
review_content: Got it, copied some PS4 games to it without issue. Then went to play one and it randomly disconnected and the PS4 couldn't fix the drive.Guess that's what I get for trying Seagate again. WD for me!
title: Randomly disconnected from my PS4 and got corrupted

author: Carissa W.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2020
review_content: I specifically bought this product to back up my Mac which runs on iOS 10.6.8. I finally got around to opening it up and trying it out, and to my surprise it will not work because it says my operating system is too old. I bought it to back up my Mac so that I can update my operating system! Now it’s too late to return it. Even brand new printers and usb drives I have gotten work with my current system. Extremely disappointed and wish I could get my money back. I wish it would have said this somewhere but I do not remember seeing that warning about not running on Mac 10.6.8 anywhere before buying.
title: DOES NOT WORK ON MAC 10.6.8

author: S.B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2019
review_content: This is nice as it has a lot of storage.  Please know before you purchase this that is not a portable unit.  This product has to be plugged into an electrical outlet before it will work.  It will need to be placed at a stationary location for ultimate convenience.  It does have to be plugged into the outlet and your computer before the light will come on letting you know that it is working.  I would not purchase this again only due to it not being portable but other than that it seems to be a good product.  I do like the fact that it has a long electric plug in.
title: Not impressed with the portability of it

author: JRH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2019
review_content: This 4TB disk was bought for a backup of data, right now about 1.5 TB. Copying the files is slow,. I did register the disk drive with Seagate. The registration did not improve the speed as some reviewers noted.  The disk tends to run warm, not hot to the touch. Previous Seagate drives had an aluminum housing that helped with cooling. This drive has a thin plastic housing that does little to help. So far, 1 day, the disk drive is operating without errors, but taking forever to copy about 1 TB
title: Slow drive with good 4TB capacity

author: Smoore
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020
review_content: At first I was worried I had bought refurbished or used because the packaging was not sealed and there wasn’t an official packaging label. However, once I plugged it into my MacBook Air all the startup info popped up. I did have to erase and setup for a Mac which was a bummer but didn’t take but 5 min. I’m currently writing to it now and am pleased to finally have extra storage, my MacBook is maxed out! This is my 2nd Seagate portable external hard drive 2TB. My other one is formatted for Windows so I needed one for my Mac. Very user friendly and easy to navigate.
title: Best Additional Storage for MacBooks

author: Dave
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2019
review_content: This is mostly a good drive.  BUT be aware that you have to use a USB port directly attached to your computer.  I have a USB extender/spliter and it won't work from that.  That's kind of unexpected since other portable hard drives DO work from it.As others have noted, slow write speed.  I don't care much about that since it's just for occasional backup.  But something to be aware of.Updated and changed from 4 stars to 1.  Had this about 6 months.  Error Code 0x800701e3.  Drive is dead.
title: Mostly good but...

author: Coco T
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020
review_content: Although most of the reviews here were glowing, mine was one of the ones that failed after just three months - which was indeed reported here and I wish I'd read through the negative reviews before purchase. Although the drive lights up when I plug it into the computer (MacBook Air), it isn't recognized on the computer. I thought it might be a bad USB cable, so tried testing it with a different cable from my other (different brand) hard drive. That other hard drive loads up fine with both its original cable and the cable from the Seagate drive I purchased here, while the Seagate won't load with either. Thus, I conclude the unit itself is the issue. The drive has sat on a desk for three months and not been dropped or moved around - no reason whatsoever to explain its sudden failure.I foolishly purchased two of these Seagate drives and backed up two copies of ALL of my data onto them. I am praying the second one won't die before I can transfer all of the data off of it. What a waste of $220 - since I won't use the other drive moving forward either. This was my first time using SEAGATE. Very disappointed and WILL NOT EVER BUY A SEAGATE DRIVE AGAIN.PS as others noted it copies data very slowly. I didn't really care about that, so long as the data was preserved... but... epic FAIL all around.
title: FAILED. Will not ever buy a SEAGATE drive again.

author: ink
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2020
review_content: I've had nothing but problems when trying to use this as a backup drive for MacOS. I'm using Catalina 10.15.5 as of which is the most recent update as of the time of this review. I've had to issue an RMA and request a replacement at least once, which Seagate had no issue with replacing. Thank you Seagate. But...I have the drive partitioned to have 1TB reserved for Time Machine and the rest reserved for regular backup of files from my Macbook. I use it exclusively with my only MacOS device so both partitions are formatted journaled by default. The backups seem to work just fine until Time Machine is active for about a week. Then it completely stops working. It won't mount and if I happen to get lucky and it does mount, it gives me an error and I have to reformat the entire drive.This has happened with both the original and the replacement so I don't know where to go from here. I've never had issues like this with a Seagate product and this isn't the first Seagate product I've bought. Usually I'm satisfied. But I can't in good faith give this anything above a 1 star just because it won't do the most simple task without screwing up.
title: Do NOT use this as a Time Machine backup drive on MacOS

author: Nefertiti
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2019
review_content: *Very* disappointed to find, despite the description that this hard drive is suitable for Mac, that I will have to go through a rather complicated reformatting process in order to use it with Mac. This should have been clearly stated in the description. Only when I plugged it in and got to online instructions did it say: "Configure your drive. This drive is set up to work with a Windows PC." Not as advertised.
title: NOT Automatically compatible with Mac

author: Anthony L. Bussard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2020
review_content: I purchased this product in January 2020 to use as a drive for routine backups. It was plugged into a USB 3 port on a Windows 10 Pro box. Most of the backups are quite large coming in around ~50 gigs. The speed and throughput on the device was acceptable and the drive functioned well.It was ordered in January 2020 and there were no issues until mid-March. At that time, the drive started to randomly connect and disconnect. I tried a number of fixes, such as changing cables/ports, updating/reinstalling device drivers and changing USB power settings in both Windows and the BIOS; however, nothing worked. I ran CHKDSK on the drive and there were no errors. It got to the point the drive was connecting/disconnecting every 10 - 15 minutes.I shucked the drive because I think there was an issue with the drive controller in the enclosure. The drive itself is an 8TB Barracuda Compute. The drive is now in a Sabrent EC-DFLT and so far so good. There have been no issues. I'll keep it connected over the next few days to see if the issue reappears.My feeling is this is a good drive with a bad enclosure. If that's the case, no harm, no foul because I got an 8TB drive for a very reasonable price.
title: I Had to Shuck the Drive

author: J Gillespie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2019
review_content: Best value for your money. I bought this to extend the storage on my PS4 Pro and it works beautifully without issue or lag. Purchased a second one for my Xbox One X and it works perfectly with it as well.The best part is it does not use an external power supply and only a Single USB connection. This provides clean and simple installation.My only complaint is that 4TB is the max capacity at this time.
title: Best solution for PS4 & Xbox One expansion

author: Niki Gray
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2020
review_content: I bought this external drive after many many years of faithful service from my old Seagate drive (so old the largest capacity available was 250GB) and it STILL works so this brand was the obvious choice when I went shopping for external storage for my PS4. So far so good too! It was beyond easy to set up (the PS4 does it by itself, no issues) and there’s no noticeable load time difference between games on my console and games on the external drive.I’ve noticed no issues as of yet so if this review goes unupdated all is well still!
title: Great for PS4 External Drive

author: ssj_100
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2019
review_content: I've have several "passport" type HDD, all about similar capacity and this one is bar far the worst.  Just trying to copy large files or a lot of files at the same time causes the hard drive to hang.  It constantly disconnects and reconnects thus causing file transfers to stall wasting potentially hours of my time.  I've never had this issue before with other hard drives.  With these issues happening from just copying my files, I seriously cannot trust this hard drive with my data.  I suspect it will run into disk issues and corrupt my data very soon.
title: Absolutely horrible harddrive

author: Dara
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2019
review_content: I've used Seagate external hard drives for years but it's just not worth it anymore. They typically fail within a year so I buy the rescue plans - it's gotten to where they fail much quicker than that and then the replacement Seagate sends fails nearly immediately - I suspect they're sending refurbished hard drives. And it's a ton of work to even get the replacement (on the phone with customer service). Not worth it - switching to Toshiba whose drives seem to last longer.
title: No more Seagate

author: Joe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2020
review_content: I was wondering why this was so cheap. I used it for storage on my Xbox one x. A few months after receiving it there was a loud clicking sound and all of my games failed to load. I reformatted the drive and it seemed to work, but I didn't want to risk losing 8TB worth of games again. I requested a replacement through seagates website that went smooth. About 4 months later it happened again. Same clicking and everything isn't working. I reformatted and reinstalled. A few weeks later same thing happened. My warranty is now expired and I'm left with a paperweight. My MUCH older 4TB WD drives are doing great.
title: Not for xbox or playstation!

author: The Lifelong Learner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2020
review_content: I just needed a new backup drive. I have another Seagate I'm quite happy with, so I choose this one.I typically back up in less than 2 hours.  This one says it will take 23 hours!!  And the time keeps getting extended. And it won't let me backup the system folder.  What's the point of a backup drive if it doesn't go more than 5 mph?  And it leaves part of the information behind?Absolutely NO INSTRUCTIONS are included in the box - or online!  Seagate publishes documentation on other drives, but not this one.  Very disappointed.  I may be returning it.
title: In the Dark with No Instructions

author: Gracey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2020
review_content: This is portable external hard drive is the only thing that my son asks for his birthday. He needed an additional storage he is running out of storage from his ps4. Contrary to the reviews I read, he didn't have any problem connecting or formatting it on his ps4. He just connected it and his ps4 recognized the device right away. He also did the formatting using the ps4. He didn't encounter any problem at all.  I got him the 2 TB and its working perfectly fine ever since he got. Since July 6 to be specific. It is portable , very easy to use and worth the price.
title: portable , very easy to use and worth the price

author: Gi Ras
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020
review_content: I wasn't sure this would work for my PS4, so I went to Gamestop prior to purchasing and asked the gamer guys if it would work.  They said that this would be perfect as long as it is hdd 3.0, just needs to be formatted to the PS4. Glad to hear it because this saved me like $30 (the ps4 seagate is $90+).  Plugged it in before turning on my ps4, went to settings>devices, selected the external storage, ps4 prompts you if you would like to format, after a series of yes's and OK's, the hdd was formatted.  You have to then go to your storage and select the games you want to move to the external memory.  Took about an hour to transfer my 8 games from the internal memory to the external seagate, but now I have room for about 50 more games!! Save yourself a few bucks and get this one for your ps4!
title: Worked for my PS4!! Saved me $$

author: Canyondreamer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2019
review_content: Wanted to offload ~5TB of video files from four 2TB drives to this 8TB drive to free them up for other tasks. Took several overnight transfers, but successfully completed. Made the terrible mistake of deleting the files on the smaller drives and starting to use them for other stuff on these drives. One month after purchase the 8TB drive crashed, never to be assessible again, clearly corrupted. Bought recovery software that could not find any files on the drive. Took it to a data recovery place who was able to recover about 60% of the files and told me the drive was physically damaged. Paid a fortune for this misadventure. Don't want a replacement or bother with a physical repair - as I will never trust it again. Live and learn!!
title: Died after one month and took all my files with it!!

author: Chris Miller
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2019
review_content: I purchased this portable drive to transfer my files from my computer which doesn't have a large hard drive and was nearly filled. After putting all of my important files onto it, and having had it for about 3 weeks, the drive has stopped working. My best guess is that it was somehow damaged in the computer case because the casing for the drive is made of thin, cheap plastic which is prone to being squeezed. Bottom line - the construction lead to the damage and loss of function. Now I have no files. I would not recommend this product, though I would say I expected more from Seagate. I have used their products for decades and have never seen shotty construction like this for one of their products until now.
title: Cheap casing - Easily Broken

author: Rex
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2020
review_content: I own several of these drives, purchased at different times over a few years. I keep coming back because they are reliable, quiet, sturdy and extremely portable. I recommend you buy a case if you're going to transport them, and Case Logic has one that fits perfectly. I've never had an issue and in the future if I need more storage this is the drive I will buy.
title: My Favorite External Drive

author: Cesar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2019
review_content: I had a hard time choosing portable drives because everyone advised me different brands and it was really difficult to me picking one that would be good and would last enough. At the end I decided on this brand and haven't had problems since then, I've had this for over 3 months now. I hope they last for much more time. I really recommend to buy the hard case and use this hard drive on it always so the risk of it falling is really reduced. You have to be really careful with hard drives because they can fail completely or get unfixable damage if they fall.
title: Recommended.

author: Sena
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
review_content: So far so good. Bought this to replace my WD Passport 4TB HDD that started making a clicking sound. So far my old WD is copying all my data to this new 5TB Seagate with no problems. I don't have a super fast computer and can only hook one drive up to my USB 3.0 and the other to 2.0 and it is copying at an avg. of 30MB/s. Fast enough for me as I'm only copying about 500GB at a time. I take breaks between migrating the data as I have had issues with massive transfers with HDD drives in the past. Will update if any issues arise.
title: Working great so far. Small drive with a lot of storage.

author: M. Schmidt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2020
review_content: Purchased this as a gift for a close friend and while testing it I found only one thing that I didn't like.  That one thing was that when you delete something off of it the 'item' isn't removed.  After deleting the item, you MUST clean the drive to regain the space used by the deleted item.  No where is that information identified, I stumbled upon that when I filled the disk and started deleting the files but did not regain space.  Other than that the drive is fast and, after testing, I believe it to be reliable.  Very pleased with my purchase.
title: Handy, light device

author: Jerry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020
review_content: I store computer disk images on external drives with Acronis True Image for back-up purposes. This is the second 8tb drive I bought for that purpose since I alternate the backup procedure between the 2 drives in case one of drives fails, or becomes corrupted somehow. Beware that the USB cable supplied is non-standard, so don't lose it. If you have smaller Seagate external drives, their USB cables and power supplies may not work on this larger drive. Overall, it has an attractive storage to price ratio. Speed is good, but I am willing to wait for the disk images to be created (usually at night). I have several Seagate external drives of various sizes, though one of the smaller drives I purchased several years ago has failed.
title: Enough Storage to back-up your computers

author: Gert
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2019
review_content: Planned to use this drive as mini-NAS on a Raspberry RPI4B with USB3. The RPI4B 3Amps supply fails to power up this drive! The RPI4B pulls (max) 1.8A during powerup so the disk should have 1.2A left. (All USB 5V terminals in the RPI are joined). But still not good enough. A prev. generation Toshiba 2T launches & works fine on the RPI4B. The ST drive works on desktop PC backpanel USB3 port. Frontpanel ports also seem to be not good enough. USB3 spec says for devices to not exceed 0.9A. This one clearly fails the spec! Gets only 2stars. I had wanted to avoid a powered hub at the RPI but that's what I have to do next.
title: Pulls too much startup current for RPI4B

author: table
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2020
review_content: I bought this to hold 4k movies (70gb in size) to stream to my Macbook Pro, so I don't damage my SSD by writing half of its contents over just to watch a movie. This external HDD lags, as it can't read the file fast enough, so sad. Took about 10 minutes to copy 82GB over through TB3 by the way.
title: Can't Stream 4k

author: Keely
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2020
review_content: I purchased this drive on Prime Day in 2019 and it failed within a few months. I tried all the repair solutions available but the drive was suddenly unreadable and unmountable. It was plugged into a surge protector and in a spot on my desk where it did not move at all from the day it was installed - no jostling, jolting, etc.  It just stopped working.  I contacted tech support, heard back from them 6 days later with a link to their warranty page and told me to follow the instructions and ship the drive back at my own expense - they provided a "return shipping label" that was just the address. Disappointed.
title: Failed in 9 months - data lost- had to pay to ship back for replacement when failed under warranty

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2020
review_content: I bought this(1TB portable Seagate) because I needed more space for my files and things. Right from the start it showed problems. My computer had some difficulty reading it as a drive at 1st (was calling it a phone) and once I looked into it it already had files and folders on it. Individually since they were at most some KBs you'd think altogether it'd be some MBs worth of space gone. Nope. The device only had about 930GB of space instead of the 1TB it was supposed to have. And those files didn't seem to have anything to do with allowing the device to function. The other problem is that it would only allow copies of certain files to go in but wouldn't open them unless they existed on my computer's drive still. That defeats the purpose of its use. The last but biggest problem is that while and after using it my internal drive would fluctuate on the amount of space I had until it ran dangerously low when I hadn't been adding any new files or apps or even doing anything to cause the decrease of space after I disconnected this device. Maybe I got a bad one but I don't recommend this. I don't appreciate the possibility that I was given a virus either. I returned it and got a refund.Zero stars for uselessness and I suppose 1 star because it was small and portable and only needed to be plugged in directly to "get started".
title: Was not a full 1TB & I don't recommend

author: fussy consumer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2019
review_content: I attempted to use the drive but when I started looking into it for what files were being captured I could make no sense of the data or what the files names meant. In one folder I had a list of files from 1 to 65. I couldn't find my regular files like Excel, Word and files from other programs. I continued to get error messages when I tried to back up my computer and then it would tell me 1 of 5 files saved. I spoke with technical support three times and I finally gave up and returned the drive.
title: Unreadable Files

author: James F
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2020
review_content: All of that 8 days after my return window.I think the issue happened when I was unpacking data from a zip software called .7z.Steps:1. Unzipped (.7z)2. Looked at the unzipped data - all good3. transferred the data to aws4. Now my HD won't mount on Mac OS (10.13 and 10.15), Ubuntu or Windows 10. Also, doesn't show up in the disk utility.5. Realized I wasted a lot of time on this along with lost data.Lame because I didn't have this problem with a Western Digital.I'm not sure if this is something with .7z type of files, although the data was what we ordered and came from a trusted source, a co-worker.Anyway, I'm bummed on Seagate and that I've read similar things happening to other people.
title: The thing crashed and now it won't mount anywhere, lost my data

author: KrisyWhit
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2020
review_content: I bought this as a backup drive/extra storage for my MacBook Air. Very standard for external storage. Easy to use and transfer documents and other files. I make a lot of videos which can eat up computer memory space and so this was a perfect solution. Only problems I've had for it were (1), MacBook Air doesn't have a USB input so I had to buy an adapter, (2) for some reason it won't allow my computer to do a system back up (always comes up with an error), and, (3) I usually have to force eject the drive because it always says an applications is using it even when it's not. Not too big of a deal except for the system back up. Will have to find a way to fix that.
title: Lots of Storage but Not Compatible for Back Up?

author: John B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2020
review_content: Before I bought this, I checked my iMac's system and it has USB 3.0, but so far it has taken 2.5 hours to do an initial back up 72GB out of 137GB.  I thought this was supposed to be faster, not slower, than the ancient Western Digital external drive the Seagate replaced.  The iMac is for home use - photos, music, docs - that's it.
title: Slow.  Really slow.

author: njzeus
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2019
review_content: I have this attached to my PC laptop strictly for storage.  I use it as my personal digital library - with copies of every film, tv show, song, family video, etc.  This has plenty of space for loads of everything!  It replaced three older 500gb to 2tb drives easily.  Transfer rates are good both to and from the drive, and it does go into a sleep mode to preserve power when not in use.  I would definitely recommend this to anyone storing quantities of video files in particular - the space goes way too fast on smaller drives.  If you’re just storing photos and music, or want to travel with it, one of the smaller Seagate drives that runs off usb power only would be the way for you to go.
title: Great additional storage option

author: Eli Blumkin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2020
review_content: My older generation xbox only had 500gb, and as popular games today take up more and more storage space, my xbox could only hold 3-4 games before running out of space. This hard drive was an absolutely life saver and a must buy in my opinion, as it finally gives me enough space to download 10+ games without having to worry about space. The connectivity was very smooth, and the compact size of the hard drive made it very easy to move around.The seagate 1tb hardrive is an excellent pick for external storage, and would be a perfect fit to expand your storage on your Xbox or computer.
title: Excellent Way to Increase Storage Space on an Xbox

author: Shakespeare
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2020
review_content: I plugged this bad boy into my Xbox one and after following a few simple prompts on the screen I was saving games right off. It serves my needs nicely. I could care less about the packaging because I just throw that out any old way. If you are like I was and looking to expand your XBOX one storage then I say go for it because int has been sound as a pound for me!
title: XBOX ONE LOVES IT

author: Mike Anderson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2020
review_content: I forgot these things take so much space for them selves to run. With an 8T you only get to use 7T. If I had remembered I would have moved up to the  10T because I really need all 8, but that was my fault ( I wasn't thinking) I saw 8, saw the price and went for it. This is a fast unit, a good looking and impressive unit. If you need 7T or less this is the unit for you. It was my mistake, so I'm not sending it back, I think I'm just going to get another one. BTW, I'm a Multi format DJ / VJ of 42 years and a Photographer, that's why I need so much room.
title: Know what you need

author: Ryan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2020
review_content: I'm using it for my 2nd Xbox..  Not sure why, but it runs CONSTANTLY when plugged in. The status LED is always on or flashing, and you can feel it spinning.  I'm expecting this to shorten its life span.  I have a different portable Seagate on my other Xbox and it only runs when queried.Also, FYI  (not a big deal) you have to create an additional partition before the Xbox will format it for game storage.  If you just plug it in out of the box the Xbox will only recognize it as a media drive.  I made a partition as small as possible and it let me use the remainder for Xbox format.
title: Runs 100% of the time!?!

author: Marco Felix
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019
review_content: It seems a bit wrong to give this a one star as its not that bad and does do its job but since most the reviews are overwhelmingly positive I thought that it needed to get checked this thing is super slow sadly i only purchased because the WD external 1 tb hd was out of stock this hard drive is slower than any other drive I've ever owned slower than my sd card which is how I now have to use this drive first i download to the sd then I transfer and its making me a bit depressed as I know i wont be returning it and looking for a faster drive its just not what i want to do now that I have 500 gb worth of stuff stored on it. Also I should note that this is primarily for games that I cant store on my gaming laptop meaning its the worst possible situation to put a slow drive into as my loading time into matches becomes a laughing stock in the team chat it has been compared to a potato and it has even been said that dial up connection is faster sadly these comments are nothing but the truth steer clear of this if you wish to do anything more than store documents on it.
title: Slower than a potato

author: Amanda
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2019
review_content: I bought myself a new laptop and didn't realize it had barely any storage on it. I have a small business where I have to have to design programs on the computer and it wouldn't even let me download those two programs. Ever since I bought this portable hard drive my computer is running so much better I was able to download the programs I needed save a ton of documents and pictures and it's even faster then when I got it out of the box. I'm not sure if I'll ever use 2Tb but hey at least I have it. It's also very very light and portable. I haven't had any technical issues with it so I haven't had to speak with a technician so I didn't mark down any stars for that I even bought the matching protective case which is perfect for it
title: Money very well spent my computer runs so much better now

author: Mr Night
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2020
review_content: I purchased this to expand my Xbox One X’s storage. With the large library that Game Pass offers, and my large collection from the 360 days, the stock 1TB drive in my One X was filling up. I pondered upgrading to an SSD, but decided on having the multiple TB’s of space over the speed. So far so good as of 10/19/20, I’ll update if any issues arise. For those of you who intend on keeping your Xbox One’s for the foreseeable future even with the new Series X soon releasing, this is a great buy.
title: Spacious 5TBs, fair speed for a mechanical drive, good price.

author: Cari Weis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2020
review_content: Literally out of nowhere, my Seagate started making beeping sounds and my computer would not recognize it at all. This happened only SIX MONTHS after I bought it. I called tech support and the guy said he's heard of this issue before and he thinks it's just a faulty cord. He tried to sell me another cord lol. Instead I took it to the Geek Squad to have them take a look. The guy tried five different cords and none of them changed the situation. He said it was completely dead. Nothing even happened to it. Why did it do this?? I'm a freelance graphic designer....absolutely ALL of my client's design work, invoices, business templates, tax info, personal photos, etc. was on that hard drive. I lost EVERYTHING. It took me months to rebuild all of my work from the ground up (unpaid of course). Well lesson learned...shame on me for not backing up my work on a cloud-based storage system. That's what I'm doing now :(
title: HORRIBLE PRODUCT that died unexpectedly

author: digtheisland
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2019
review_content: I am changing the review I originally wrote for the first Seagate ext HD I ordered and repeated for this one. Mine is still fine, but the 2nd one, a gift for a 33 y.o. g/son was dropped from the PC hard drive tower to the top of his desk which is wood. The internal drive is broken and the repair cost is very high as is any attempt to retrieve his data. It still sits on my desk trying to figure out what to do about it. I on 3 Toshiba HD that I've had for years to backup individually my most important software programs, genealogy and recipes + family photos. Still working like a charm. I'm letting g/son keep mine and replacing his broken one with a smaller Toshiba to save myself extra expense.
title: Drive failure

author: Chuck in the Rockies
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2020
review_content: I use this 5T drive to back up everything.  I have internal drives of 2G and 4G.  This little unit sits to the side as my second backup and I use Beyond Compare to back up everything on a regular basis. I use Beyond Compare because it is a sync system with no unique compression, simply a file tracking and copy system - for syncing/comparing.  with 5T no worries about having enough room, no need to compress. I can simply grab the 5T and take it with me and use it on my other computers.
title: A good total back up drive

author: FJL
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2020
review_content: This is the second Seagate external hard drive I have purchased for backups.  The first one is 1TB and I use it for a backup I keep in our safe.  The new one is for my new computer to use for the Windows Backups and all my files and Outlook Email.  Windows backs up regularly, but I manually back up Outlook email and my files stored on my other external hard drive which are not kept on my PC.  I know my system may seem tedious, but I like having control over my personal files and email, which are not kept on my PC.  And I NEVER use the cloud for back up.  Seagate has never disappointed me.
title: Great backup drive

author: Hart Dahlhauser
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020
review_content: Got this to use as extended storage on PS4 and it couldn't have been easier. Just plug in to your console and follow prompts for formating. I ended up with 4.6 TB of available storage. Very easy to move applications from internal hard drive to external, just go to Settings -> Storage -> System Storage -> Applications. Hit options button and select all the apps you want to move. First time I moved maybe 50-60 GB and it seemed like it took at least 4 hours. You can't play games or use apps while transferring. Last night I selected over 200GB to transfer and I went to bed and let the system work and then shut itself off after no activity. Checked this morning and all the data made it over to the external drive.I was considering a larger drive, but it was going to be physically larger and require a dedicated power supply. This 5TB Seagate portable is a great match for my PS4 slim b/c it only uses a USB cord and it's about the size of a deck of Uno cards. Will be very easy to pack and carry.I cannot tell a difference in playing games once I have moved them to external storage. Load times are the same. No noticeable lag in gameplay or anything. Frees up system storage for game saves and photo/vid caps. I freed up about 500GB of system storage and still have 4 TB on the external drive. My largest games are around 100GB (RDR2, Gran Turismo Sport), but most are around 50GB. So I have room for like 50+ more games.Even if you play from discs, PS4 games use a lot of storage. Even the 1TB systems will fill up after you boot up a few games. This external drive is a great value and a way to add a ton of storage to the PS4.
title: Easy way to add storage to PS4

author: T Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2019
review_content: This very portable 4T drive cost me the same as my 2T Seagate stationary external tower drive did in 2013. The speed and performance are identical without the need for the power adaptor, cooling fan or giant ventilated metal housing. Some of the first hard drives stored a whole 20 Megabytes and cost $300 way back in 1990. I remember carrying that kind of unit home on BART, holding it level in my hand so carefully to prevent any kind of shock that could swipe the reading arm across the magnetic tracks like a needle scratching across an old vinyl album would. Aftermarket programs became available to actively park the arm in a safe position for travel and then they were integrated into manufacturing them. This tiny portable unit is so sound by comparison I feel it would be perfectly safe to play catch with it in your backyard or to put it in your pocket for a trip to the moon.
title: Six Years Later...

author: k.sech
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2020
review_content: I bought this about 11 months ago. It's been chirping on occasion for about 3 months. I learned this has something to do with power? Either way - it's losing data to corruption. I've tried repairing files and sectors, but I fear I've lost a lot of data. I won't be replacing it with a Seagate. I have a WD that's over 2 years old and still working fine and it even gets moved around a lot more than this one.
title: Didn't last a year

author: Maya
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2020
review_content: I received this yesterday and cannot say how well it works for the long haul, but I was impressed that it came with adapters for all known electrical systems. There is a plug for each area that has a different plug. It came with each packaged separately. So, it would be very portable. I have always used Seagate. I have one Western Digital and it appears to be ok as well. Over the years I have purchased them from 500 gigs to 8 tb and I will use this one for just my backups since they take up a lot of space. If I find it has issues I will update.
title: Seagate is always my first choice

author: Yellow Lab Dog
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2020
review_content: This drive is excellent. Works well. I have been buying this brand for years.  Perfect for my personal photos and videos and any other documents. Thank you for a great product that I received. The older external drives of 5 TB that I bought in 2019 are also working well as are the 1 tb drives I bought in 2014. Happy with this product.
title: Excellent external Drive

author: Aliencasinos420
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2020
review_content: Works great with the Xbox One X. Plug this into your Xbox into the usb on the back on USB port 1. Turn on the Xbox. The Xbox will ask you if you want to format the drive for use click yes and then it will ask you if you want to store games on this drive click yes and then your done. It’s that simple. Flawless. Don’t hesitate. You won’t find anything cheaper that will work better than this.
title: Great for Xbox One X

author: L. Torres
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
review_content: I bought this product almost two years ago, mesmerized by the data footprint capacity and the price.  I own both Windows and MacOS computers and I tend to want to use exFAT for portability, at some point I had a failure like the one in the image, when I ran a scan the drive was rendered unwritable.  I called tech support, who happened to have been less than helpful, and was told that exFAT wasn't a "reliable" format despite my other WD drives having no issues with it.  Afraid of an impending data loss, I copied whatever vital data I could on older external drives that I had lying around, reformatted to the "recommended" NTFS and recopied my data again.  The problem started happening again three months ago.  I have not run any scans because I'm afraid I'll make my drive unwritable and don't have another drive lying around anymore to distribute the data.  I would not recommend this brand.  It's sad to see that after years of a good name, Seagate has become just another mediocre corporation with abhorrent support values.
title: High failure rate and terrible support.

author: TWhite
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2020
review_content: Do not buy this garbage, it is complete junk. It appears that I received a used hard drive... The shipping box arrived generic white sticker holding the box shut, but upon opening the shipping box I noticed that the plastic packaging that holds the hard drive was already opened (was basically just two plastic sheets laying on top of one another with the hard drive freely flopping around in between). The casing of the actual hard drive has finger prints and smudges all over with additional scratches around the cable port.I don't know if I received a returned item or what, but this is unacceptable. Moreover, the quality of the product is a bit disconcerting, I have cases for chewing gum in my bag that feel more robust than this "portable" hard drive...it is flimsy and feels fake. Even without the appearance of being a used item, I would be hesitant to store anything meaningful on this hard drive... poor, poor, poor quality on this product.
title: This Thing is Complete Junk and Appears to Be Used Product

author: Michel J Plante
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2020
review_content: I purchased two of these drives, one was going to be primary and one a backup.  After formatting the first one to MAC, it was slow on the very first file transfer to it.  Then the next thing I know, my MacBook Pro started to bog down.  And then the next thing I know, it completely crashed!  Umm, I thought well this could me my laptop so lets fire everything back up.  Same thing!  When ejected hard drive, all was fine.  Proceeded to transfer to another hard drive and everything went at speed it normally does through USB 3.0.As for the 2nd one, I didn't even take it out of the box to be honest.  If first one performed this way, I'm not going to have great faith in the 2nd one.  I returned and got the ones I have several of that have given me good luck, Seagate Expansion 8TB (with the rough looking side).I realize hard drives are a delicate piece of equipment and that's why I say it could just be a bad batch that perhaps got dropped while shipping or something.  Clearly there are many good reviews and people do have good luck as I have had with my other Seagates.  But just wanted to share my experience with this one.
title: Must be a bad batch, unusual for Seagate

author: Ray
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2019
review_content: Bought this back on November 21, 2018 to use as an extended drive for my PS4. setup went smoothly and all worked well. That is until last night while downloading a game on rest mode. As I turned on the console to see if the game downloaded I got an error stating that the disk need to be repaired (the error you get for unplugging the disk while its writing data) due to possible data corruption.While the repair was running a messege popped stating that the disk had been unplugged.
