I go turn off the console unplug everything & replug it all back. Start the console decide to try the repair and the same issue happens. I try to reformat the disk. But the same error, when the disk is reformatting message pops up saying its unplugged.Connecting it to a computer to format it did work for a while so I tried to format it to FAT and then plug it to the PS4 to reformat as extended drive. Same errorAt this point The ps4 won't recognize at all the HDD. No matter what I try. Right now I filed a claim to see if with the warranty I get a replacement. I'll wait & see...
title: Works well till it expires

author: C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2020
review_content: I bought 2 of these drives and 1 drive started giving me problem doesn't write properly cant edit my pictures and save. I am a professional photographer that constantly takes pictures and edit. I have 2 computers and it's not the computer thank God I have 2 4tb wd drive that I have as backup. Now I have to go and by wd instead. I both these because I didnt like how wd 7tb standup design eventhough they priced at the same. Disappointed in this company I havent bought them for over 10 years now I remember why. Problems!!!! I haven't called customer service  because I dont have the time
title: Bad! Less than 6 months and problems already

author: M. Frank
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2020
review_content: You know those new, crazily-great priced, light-weight, Windows laptops are amazing, right? But disk space, not so much.I didn’t want to break the bank on external storage, so I tried this cute little 1tb Seagate external drive, and I’m very pleased.I don’t run around with it, expose it to all kinds of troublesome conditions. (I’ve done that with other equipment, but I wanted it simply to support a lightweight laptop.) For my purpose, it’s perfect.... and so is the other one I bought. ... and the one I sent to a friend ...
title: Brilliantly small, inexpensive digital storage.

author: Daniel Waterman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020
review_content: I added a bunch of family photos and docs on our 1 Tb drive.  After 17 months, no damage, sitting in a desk drawer, it's no longer able to detect the device.  Seagate tried to send a free recovery application, but the device isn't even detectable.  It would be another $250 to proceed, so I'm going to a buddy who can do it for free, then buying a new device.
title: Corrupt after 17 months

author: CB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2020
review_content: Product advertised as working for PC and Mac. After following setup instructions for my iMac, when it didn’t, I called tech support. They told me it would NOT work for a Mac and that I needed to order a different product. In other words, false advertising.
title: Won’t work as advertised

author: Kenneth Heitzenrater
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2019
review_content: My wife and I do grave photos for Find A Grave and I bought a USB memory device for storing them on while processing them and it was too slow for acquiring the photos once stored.  I can shift my use from my MacBook Pro to my iMac with the external hard drive.  It gives me faster retrieving time for the phots in storage and it has adequate storage for what I want and the price.  The bad thing is the plug to the device could be tighter and seems bent a little.
title: External Hard Drive

author: Dave
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2020
review_content: Using this for an external drive on my PS4 and it gets the job done, although it seems a bit slower than i expected. I will likely replace it with a SSD along with the internal PS4 drive. Games that load from this one take longer to load when compared to the internal PS4 drive, but that could be due to the USB connection.But for the size and the price i cant complain too much. I’d recommend this drive to anyone running out of room on their PS4 who are on a budget and running out of storage.
title: More storage for less money.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020
review_content: Where to begin... I thought I was getting a pretty decent deal on a 2TB hard drive. For a while it seemed to work fine as a xbox one expansion. Eventually we started having issues getting the xbox to allow us to connect controllers to it. I did not even consider that this hard drive was to blame. We would have to restart the xbox a few times to get the connect button to function on the console.Finally we noticed that some of our content wasn't displaying on the console. I looked through the storage and noticed the external hard drive wasn't connecting anymore. Unplugged it, restarted console repeatedly. We tried everything. Finally we got it to connect and low and behold, the controller connect button no longer functions! I still assumed i was dealing with two separate issues.So about now I'm getting pretty frustrated with the whole situation. My external hard drive is trash, and my kid's less than year old xbox one x is apparently on the verge of becoming trash. I unplug the hard drive and move it to a different xbox to see if the storage or the xbox is to blame. Now imagine my surprise when the controller connect button on the second xbox now doesn't work. The hard drive doesn't work either. Everything works fine until I plug in this particular hard drive. And everything goes back to fine when I remove it.Do yourselves a favor and buy a better hard drive.Update - I have started the quest to see if it's possible to return this device back to whatever it came from. So far seagate has said it will not be a problem as long as I give them pretty much every piece of personal information that makes me who I am. They also want me to review their information privacy policy which makes me think that my information will very soon be for sale. I guess I'll just eat the cost of this one.
title: Where to begin... total crap

author: Rick in Colorado
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2020
review_content: Lost everything on the drive exactly 1 month after the data recovery warranty expired. Unbelievable.Based on the noises coming from the drive, I suspect there would have been nothing to recover anyway. I've lost 3 Seagate drives due to hardware failures in the past 2-3 years. I'm done. Bye-bye Seagate.
title: Completely dead and making grinding noises exactly 1 year and 1 month after purchase

author: Ibuystuff
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2019
review_content: It took just a few minutes to reformat this drive and get it up and running with my macbook pro. Once I found out that the "Cloud" does not really guarantee an archival back up of my photos, I knew I needed an external storage drive on which to keep all these valuable memories. I bought this in the 2TB and the 4TB size.
title: Works Great with Macbook Pro

author: M. Emrich
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2020
review_content: This product is advertised as being compatible with a PC or a Mac. This is only partially true. When I first plugged it into my MacBook Pro, it never showed up (on a Mac, any external plug-in device automatically shows up on the desktop when it's plugged in). Turns out it was only formatted for a PC, like something out of the 1990s. I had to manually reformat the drive and it still wouldn't work. I reformatted it again and it finally worked. There are a zillion drives out there that are plug-and-play capable for PCs and Macs. This is not one of them.
title: Formatted for PC

author: S. Rodionov
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
review_content: Bought it for time machine of my MacBook Pro for work... Worked fine for one week, then disk writing errors appeared, tried to run disk utility - errors on disk writes... And now i cant return damn thing b/c i was away from home for two weeks due death in family and time passed for return of defective item.
title: Dead after week

author: Chris V
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2020
review_content: I've been using them for about a few years now and they haven't let me down. They're super affordable compared to their competitors, but the quality is on par.I've used these for my PS4, PC, and laptop. I've suffered a few power outages with it connected and luckily didn't lose a lot.You don't get a full 2TB right off the bat; you'll have to format it. You'll end up with about 1.87, but I just wish you could get the full 2TB. They're super reliable which for me makes it up in only losing 13GB.
title: Seagate is great for the price and quality.

author: Rémy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2020
review_content: This device was a great deal for the capacity (8T).  It isn't super portable like the smaller capacity devices but I was looking for high capacity at a reasonable price.  I was not concerned about a smaller size since I had no intentions of traveling with it anyway.  It is still a lower profile device and I can easiy tuck it away out of sight when not in use.  The great thing about it was it synced quickly and easily with my MacBook Pro.  The installation is always the part that makes me nervous but this was a breeze.
title: Incredibly Easy to Sync with MacBook Pro

author: Jordan s.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2020
review_content: I purchased this a couple of years ago and wrote my entire hard drives on this from two computers I’ve had for over a decade. Almost two terabytes of data worth of pictures and videos. I verified they were all copied to the new device. It took many hours. Fast forward a year, I check the external drive to see some old pictures, everything is gone. Completely wiped. Two years in Iraq, plus my entire platoons cameras worth of videos and pictures from every angle of that country. Family weddings, kids, everything, gone. I hate this so much. Lost it all. All of it. Gone. Forever.
title: Lost everything for over a decade. All gone.

author: Wilderness Techno Geek
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2020
review_content: I’m taking away one star right off the top because we bought this exact same model last year, and it died. We were in a hurry for an Xmas gift, so I rebought the same model to see if the previous one was a fluke. Last years had to be exchanged because the first one was defective.If you suddenly see this with one star, that means that the u it failed and I’ll add some choice words to the manufacturer. For now, though, it’s working and the kids are back to mindlessly wasting away their lives in front of the console.
title: Works thus far. Here’s more info on what I’m monitoring...

author: Kathy G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2020
review_content: I wanted extra storage to download photos from a photo site that was shutting down.  Spent three days downloading my treasured pictures and on the fourth day it chirped a few times and died.  My laptop could not find it anymore...just a question mark where it previously said Seagate.  Tried everything then went out and purchased a brand new laptop to plug it into as was recommended.  The new laptop told me the Seagate had a malfunction.  I read that the support was not good and frankly at my age I probably wouldn't have a clue if they gave me a list of technical things to try...I just believe my new laptop.  Every time I think of the photos I lost I cry.
title: Malfunctioned in three days...buy another brand

author: Michael Y
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2020
review_content: I purchased this device for long term storage (data backup) in a SAFE DEPOSIT BOX, so this thing was gingerly cared for and I've had 3 of them fail on me.  One was RMA Replaced, the other two I had to keep and physically destroy to prevent data loss.DO NOT BUY THIS.  IT IS GARBAGE!
title: Short Lifespan

author: Zio Emi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2019
review_content: Disk is NTFS by default. I use it on macOs Mojave, so I reformatted APFS with OS utility (I dont trust the Seagate app bundled). Not noisy at all, it does vibrate more than others when in use. Datarate transfer (with empty disk) is standard for a mechanical hdd: WRITE: 117Mb/s - READ:139Mb/s. On smooth surfaces (glass desk for example) tend to slide around: I don't understand why it doesn't have rubber feet. My trick is using a little piece of double-sided adhesive tape under hdd.Seagate is known for its reliability: I hope the disk will work without problems for at least 4/5 years
title: Datarate OK, price OK, a lot of space

author: Eric R. Lamb
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2020
review_content: This hard drive was light, the case was made of cheap plastic, and it worked only for 15 minutes before it wouldn't even power up anymore... Seagate usually makes good drives, this is not one of them... If I was to guess, the drive was probably fine, but the USB power and other electronics were bad and they died almost immediately... just a guess though... I returned the drive back to Amazon.
title: Complete junk

author: Rhonni
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2020
review_content: Plugged it into my Xbox and I was good to go! Why spend more money on a larger console? I have the 500GB model of Xbox One and I own games like Red Dead Redemption 2 and the new Call of Duty Modern Warfare which are both VERY large downloads which took up over 50% of my console's memory! On top of that, when I would remove and redownload games I was racking up usage with my internet provider! This is the external hard drive to get. Affordable and was super easy to install. Please note that it's not a full 5TB that you get, but it's very close. Just like when you guy a console, it's already got some programs installed. I think I saw some reviews that people can reprogram it or something to get the full 5TB usage, but for me, I don't really mind. I'll probably never fill the darn thing! Good product!
title: Never worry about space again!

author: Skylar Shankman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2020
review_content: Used this drive as a portable backup for video files for about a year until suddenly the read/write heads stopped working and the drive crashed. Now it's going to end up costing me about $1,000 to get the databack. Should have just spent the extra $100 or so for a better external drive in the first place. Lesson learned, won't be purchasing Seagate drives ever again.
title: Hard drive failed after 1 year, have to send it for data recovery now.

author: NOT A GTI
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020
review_content: I got this to use as a media hub connected to our home network.  I have this connected to one of the USB 3.0 ports on our Netgear AC3200/C7800 router.  I am able to map this as a \\readyshare drive on my Win10 PC and can control it like a normal drive to copy, delete, rename, etc.  It connects fine to both of our Roku boxes, as well as to all of our phones, tablets and computers so we can access files from anywhere in the house.  The only con I have noted so far is the poorly engineered location for the power light.
title: Good home network media storage

author: Joseph M. Gates
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2019
review_content: I really appreciate purchasing this 2.5 inch external hard drive versus purchasing another regular hard drive which you already have. I appreciate being able to transfer over most of my information from the damaged computer prior to sending it off to Dell technical support. I just hope that, since this was initiated on the last day of my warrantee, that going forward I will not have any warrantee and when it begins to act up and start to create problems again, I will be purchasing another computer, a desktop and, it will be the farthest thing away from a Dell. I have told many people that this is "my Dell from hell.
title: What a great compliment to a laptop.

author: Mike
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
review_content: This is a fantastic external drive. It is so much better than others that I have tried. I lost quite a bit of data with another external drive so I was a bit worried about this one. But it worked perfectly. I backed up my entire hard drive, over 700 GB and I still have 1.3TB left. Transfer rate was fast and it worked like a champ. I always trusted Seagate and I would recommend this drive to anyone who is not too tech savy. It is as easy as drag and drop.
title: Fantastic and easy to use

author: bige9888
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2019
review_content: This 8tb external hard drive works great with my xbox one.it loads games from the xbox super fast.The only thing I didn't care about was it claims 8 tb. The actual  storage is 7.2 tb .I cant complain for the price and storage . Unit co.es with 8tb hard drive and a enclosure, power pack and a usb3 cord. Just plug it in, connect usb cord and your xbox one will talk you through to get it set up and runing.
title: running. 8 TB external drive for your xbox one

author: Kyle S Morris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2019
review_content: Well I bough this back in January (only 5 months). I use this for extra storage for my XBOX. When I first got this it worked wonders, but now there are issues arising.First...I have files that disappear, no big deal I can always re-download.Second (biggest issue) the drive fails to get recognized on my XBOX and will not recognize on my PC. I have to restart my XBOX unplug and plug back in just to get it recognized only for a brief moment.Contacted customer support (Seagate webpage) and after multiple e-mails of the runaround (try to do this, try to do that) I'm no IT but I know how to troubleshoot...they now say I can get it replace. Here's the kicker....they may replace it with another drive that has been previously and refurbished...Seriously, my drive is still under warranty and only 5 months old, and it would be replace by a used hard drive that was repaired. How about replace it with a NEW hard drive since it is hardware issue. No damage to the hard drive, never dropped, no water spills.
title: Mixed Feelings

author: Jerry Kiser
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2019
review_content: Always been skeptical about using the cloud for back-up and found this 1 TB device will back up any average home computer...  Have lots of pictures I would not want to loose and perfect for this and other files that are important.  Have one for my desk computer as well and was saved when it went down with problems.  Some people trust the cloud but lot of into goes out there I just not that confident about who can see it beside me.
title: Small and contains plenty of memory for the average computer to back up everything.

author: Philip Ryan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2020
review_content: I stored about a gig of info on it when I got it. Then, I tried to write multiple files to it, intending to back up my laptop after a couple months. Less than halfway through each file transfer, it simply stops writing to the disk and has to be restarted. My old WD My Passport Ultra from about a decade ago is still soldiering on. How hard is it to make a hard drive that works? Must just be too cheap. Thanks for wasting my time and money
title: This was dead after a few months.

author: Erusman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2020
review_content: The first 14TB one I ordered was DOA, would not power on.  I am guessing damaged my the post office.  It came in just a bubble wrap package not a box.  So, I guess that would be on Amazon shipping team not packaging it well. However, my second replacement worked just fine.  Fast and lots of storage.
title: First one I ordered was DOA would not power on, second one worked fine.

author: WiFiPerJet
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2019
review_content: Had my hard drive for 4 months and out of nowhere, it won't connect to my mac. All of my YouTube content is on that hard drive and nowhere else. And without any explanation, the device will not work. It sits on the same desk all day long, and not even used every day. Nothing happened that would suggest I broke the hard drive.  It simply stopped working and I lost everything. A huge F U to Seagate. Don't use this for anything that is irreplaceable.
title: I LOST EVERYTHING

author: Rickter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2020
review_content: This is described as compatible with both Windows and a Mac.  Once you plug it in it provides software venues for either platform.  After an hour of getting nowhere trying to use it with the Mac I called customer service and was informed that it did not work with a Mac.  A week later they sent me a totally different looking drive that does work.  What is time but to waste.
title: No Go with a Mac

author: Christopher Kirtlink
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2020
review_content: First, the good: this is exactly as advertised, a cheap 8 TB backup external drive. If you're looking to store data for backup and be reasonably certain it won't mysteriously vanish, then this thing is probably perfect for you. Heck, it would probably work awesome for an external console expansion drive!however...This thing apparently writes each individual bit by hand, using some kind of microscopic monks that are sleep deprived and prone to bouts of narcolepsy. I've used hard drives on this computer from the 90's that were faster. A 5 GB file, being moved from one hard drive to another via USB 3.0 should NOT take 5 minutes. I disassembled the box and installed the drive directly, thinking MAYBE the USB was the bottleneck....it wasn't. The drive is a Seagate BarraCuda ST8000DM004 8TB 5400 RPM with 256MB Cache, which I have added to my list of hard drives to laugh at when they are suggested to me in future purchases.TL;DR : if you want lightning fast transfers, look elsewhere; if you want long-term storage with zero hassle and don't mind waiting for the data to move, then this is a very reasonably priced option.
title: Writes to disk by chiseling stone tablets?

author: Amazon Fan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2020
review_content: Yes, just what the header says. After a little more than 1.5 years of use, I've begun to get the following message when I try to backup: "Disk not ejected properly." The funny thing is I do not eject it nor am I in the process of doing so when this error message pops up. Basically, I have to try multiple times while crossing my fingers to get a full backup done.I'd avoid this drive if you're looking for long-term and reliable data storage.
title: Ejects itself

author: Derek B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 29, 2020
review_content: Drive worked great on my iMac and MacBook - very fast data transfers, partioning was a breeze.  Then it just disappeared on my drive selections. The blue power light comes on, you can feel the drive trying to start when powering it up but nothing else. I even bought a new cable since I had read another customer with a Mac said that fixed thier problem.  Now I have a $170 paper weight.l  Not what I expected from this company - will go buy a seagate drive so I can back up my files.
title: Died 7 days after return window closed

author: SPECTRA
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2020
review_content: The name Seagate and Disk Storage Technology have always been synonymous. Since pretty much the very begining of disk storage when drives by todays comparison were unthinkably  tiny in capacity and for that capacity stored on again unthinkbly huge monstrosities.My application. Main storage device controlled by Zidoo Z9S TV box. Android OS7.1 handling all file processing. READ SPEED: for Small and large files. Very fast. WRITE SPEED: for multiple small files very fast. For large file sizes (1.5GB and larger) Fast.Reliable: uptime 24\7Would hate to lose my data. Seagates been around longer than anyone else.
title: 'Seagate' period

author: Techie2000
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2020
review_content: I’m copying gigabyte sized files from a 8tb seagate drive to this 2tb seagate drive, when I copied from my internal drive to the 8TB, I got 140 MB/s write speed. Now copying from that drive to this 2TB drive (as a second backup), I’m getting 20MB/s write speed.Update: today I had to copy more files and this time they copied at speeds of 80-100MB/sec.  The interesting thing is that the average write response time was around 400 milliseconds in both the previous copies and today’s copies.
title: Sometimes good, sometimes bad

author: Kamal Thapa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2020
review_content: I bought two external HDDs of Segate brand. As I was buying two, I choose two different colors: black and silver.But when they arrived, I amazed. The silver color HDD was excellent made from Thailand, but Black HDD was made in China with very poor making, looked really cheap. They actually came in two different packing. I socked, how same brand HDDs can have completely different quality and different manufacturers.So talked with amazon customer service and returned.
title: Poor quality.

author: Tim
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2020
review_content: I play on the Xbox One X. I was tired of deleting games to download more games to play so I decided to purchased this product. It gives you 1.8 terabytes of extra storage. Very simple just plug in, format and you’re good to go. Now I can finally have all my games downloaded ready to play. I keep all my main games on my systems storage and my extra games on the external hard drive. So if you have big games like COD War Zone, Red Dead Redemption 2, GTA V and more games that requires a lot of space look no further!
title: Totally worth it! ( I’m a real gamer)

author: Emily B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2019
review_content: I bought two drives. I found that I experienced intermittent behavior in both drives. This drive comes with a USB cable. But the packaging put bends on the cable  with a radius of less than 1/4". Such small radius bends damages the cable. A packing redesign would not subject the cable to such tight bends. Amortized, this packaging redesign would cost ~$0.03. I called Amazon and they shipped replacement cables. I threw the first set of cables away. The second set (set to me free of charge) were packaged with a minimum of 1.5" radius. Much better! The intermittent problems went away. This is the case of two good products (~$100 drive and $10 cable) being hijacked by poor packaging. I didn't want to send back my drives with personal information on it (even if I "erased" it, it would still be recoverable). What headache for many customers. If I were on the board of Amazon, I would press for a full review of cable packaging and cable storage. P.B.
title: Packaging snatches defeat from the jaws of victory

author: Tennessee Phil
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2019
review_content: I've had good luck with other Seagate portable drive models, but this drive is pathetically slow.  Copying 1.5 GB to my 2 TB Seagate portable drive takes about 5 hours.  With this 5 TB drive, after 3 days it was only 50% finished. This drive was connected to the same USB 3.0 socket as the faster 2 TB drive.  After 3 days of copying, I aborted the operation and returned the drive to Amazon.
title: Do not buy.  Write speed is absurdly slow.

author: Mac D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2019
review_content: Put it in and everything connected. all lights came on and OSX recognized the drives.THEN the lights went out and all drives vanished. Checked router and plugs all were good.come to find out the included Mini-a to USB cable is crap and if it wiggles in the slightest in ANY port on back of Computer it loses connection.Ordering another cable to replace it but whoever they use to contract out that cable needs to do some better QC.
title: Works good with ONE exception

author: Wilson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020
review_content: My wife needed a portable HDD for her work, and I went with this as it was a good price for photo storage, and a convenient size.  Transfer speeds were adequate, drive has plenty of storage, but after just a couple months of extremely light use (and never wrapping the cord around it), the connection at the drive end of the cable is so loose it wont stay connected to the computer.  It has to be wiggled around and held in place.  This is extremely frustrating and makes it hard to move large batches of photos.  Unfortunately the return window is closed so I will have to seek another alternative.  Waste of money.
title: 'Value' Price, 'Value' Quality

author: Cody
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2020
review_content: I see that some people have had great success with this SSD to expand their game storage, but unfortunately I have experienced the opposite. Every game that I have on the expanded storage is now not even worth playing because of the awful stick drift that occurs. I end up spinning in circles while trying to play games. Thinking that it might be a problem with my controllers at first (because of their age and wear) I ended up deciding to buy a new one which did nothing. After doing some research, what I discovered was that the usb 3.0 cable used to connect the SSD to the console can create interference with the bluetooth signal for the controllers. As a last ditch resort I tried buying a new usb 3.0 cable and a bluetooth antenna which required drilling a hole in my PS4 to install, only to end up with the same results.I rarely leave reviews, and less so for negative experiences, but I felt others might want to know the flip side of the many positive reviews. In the end I spent a good deal of money trying to get more storage space for the remaining year that I will have this console to end up with nothing more than a new controller I didn’t really need.
title: Disappointing results

author: In the Hills
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2019
review_content: It was packaged well, an shipped fast.I use it plugged into the front usb port of my older Dish TV receiver. With a little bit of fiddling to figure out how- it became my place to store all the programs I had taped on Dish.  Newer dish receivers have hundreds of hours of taping storage capacity- but the old ones have a VERY small amount.  But using this external hard drive means almost unlimited storage now of our taped programs.I had always used a different brand for all my PC's backups, but decided to try Seagate, and I am glad I did.  It works flawlessly and has a good price.
title: works great!

author: E. Jean Carroll
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2020
review_content: THEY make you register with the NUMBER of the hard drive before it will work,......... and then do not explain where to find the number. Plus, they ask all sorts of invasive  personal questions in the registration.....gender, age, occupation, etc....and this is for A HARD DRIVE.  Plus, their registration process is a tangle of flub-ups because the application keeps closing before it is completed and you have to begin all over again---six or seven times.BAH!!
title: FORGET IT.

author: Matthieu
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2020
review_content: This is a great drive, made even better by the price. I’ve pulled open three of these 8TB enclosures so far to get to the prize inside: a Seagate BarraCuda ST8000DM004 3.5” desktop hard drive.I’ve had two of these running in my QNAP NAS in a RAID 1 configuration for nearly a year. I recently added a third 8TB drive and they have been reliably running in a RAID 5 configuration. For at least a year, these enclosures have been cheaper than buying a bare drive, so I’ve been buying them to get to drive itself. Whether you intend to use this as external storage, or to gut it for parts, I’d highly recommend them.
title: Cheap Desktop Drive for Your NAS

author: Michael Voss
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2020
review_content: I got this hard drive during July 2019, and by November 2020, the drive had already broken. I only used the drive maybe 20 times in that 15 month period. Seagate's "long term" warranty of only one year is a joke. It appears to be very fragile, despite being advertised as a portable HDD. I never knocked it around and it still mechanically failed. The head reader and other internal software broke, meaning that no computer can connect to or read it. Now it's going to be a repair upwards of $1000 because Seagate cheaped out.
title: Hard Drive failed after just over a year

author: Robert Gajewski
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2019
review_content: I was able to use this Seagate external HD on a modern HD TV that had a USB 3 connection. Older HD TVs and Blu-ray disk players support only a USB 2 flash drive. Once plugged in, I could select the USB 3 port as the video source and play MP4 files on the HD TV. Very handy. It's like another DVR to rely upon like the DVR from your cable service.Of course, it works with laptops and computer towers with USB 3 ports.
title: It's USB 3 not USB 2

author: Amadeus Platypus III
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019
review_content: I got this for movie storage to hook up to a HTPC. File transfer for large files was beyond slow... it took hours to copy over 3 TB of larger movie files (1-4GB each). Sustained transfer of smaller files fared a little better but still slow. Like 50mb/s on average. I have other Seagate drives that are solid and reliable but did not have the speed issue this does. Primary use is playback of 1080P videos on a HTPC. Time will tell but so far I think read speed for that purpose will be okay... Not sure how 4K playback will perform with this drive.
title: Sloths are faster than this drives for large transfers... small files are okay

author: alex
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2019
review_content: I bought this external hard drive in order to have more space on my xbox one s. It does what i need it to. Doesn't have a lot of space taken up initially with bloatware, which is good.  Moving the games to and from the hard drive doesn't take up much time, at most 12 minutes per game.  The games on the hard drive play at the speed they should, i didn't see any slow down in gameplay. Def. worth a buy if you need more space!
title: A great Hard drive

author: SY
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2020
review_content: I love that this is flat, and light. Others go for pricey amounts but I feel like the value is great on this one. I don't beat mine up and carry it in a padded pouch, so I didn't need the "otterbox" style ones that are expensive. It also came with instructions for reformatting it to work with a Mac, which is what I needed as on initial plug in my Mac didn't recognize the device. If you're using it on a Mac, be sure to format it first! I use mine to store downloaded media (movies) and it sill has plenty of room.
title: Love the size

author: Alyssa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2020
review_content: I am very disapointed. I was trying to back up my other hard drive to this one so that I would have a second copy incase the original fails in the years to come. When trying to copy over all of the folders I keep having problems. it will not transfer all of my folders because some of the folders has items with the same name as an item in a different folder. Since the items are in different folders it should not matter if they have items with the same name, I do not have this problem on my original other hard drive.
title: Disappointed

author: DarianDodson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2020
review_content: A spinning hard drive inside a package that is sealed and looks like an SDD?  That might be the only problem with this excellent portable drive.  It looks so much like an SDD that you may treat it like that and possibly damage the internal drive.  I have not tested this theory so I'm not sure how durable it is.  But to show you how much I love it, I've bought two more.  Love that it comes with a short USB cable and needs no power to run it.  For me, until a one terabyte SSD lowers to this price - this is the right drive for me.
title: This isn't an SDD??  Fooled me.

author: Gary
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2019
review_content: I have used Seagate and Toshiba external hard drives previously, but favored Seagate.This hard drive is wonderful.I purchased a 5Tb drive, and I love it. Ive been transferring files to my drive, freeing up space on my laptop.Im a big movie collector, so my drive has quite a number of videos, films, and TV shows on it --- no problem with transferring or watching from the drive.Sure, if Im transferring many Gigs of content all at once, the drive will go slower... Cmon folks, thats common sense.Ive had no issues, and it works beautifully.Thanks Seagate!
title: Seagate Does It Again - Amazing Ext Drive!

author: Fusty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2019
review_content: This is the first hard drive I ever purchased that arrived defective, it did not work on PS4 or PC it was not recognized, it wouldn't even let me format it, and all it did was make both units lock up and freeze when it was connected. But all is well, they are sending me another unit and I will see what happens when it arrives. UPDATE 10/5/2019 I received the second hard drive and it is working good so far, but I had to format it first with exfat on my PC before the PS4 could recognize it to format it, if you just connect it to the PS4 first it will reject it and will not format it, at least that was my experience.
title: Defective on arrival/ Second one worked

author: Kris Kringle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2020
review_content: As per reviewers have mentioned, this drive is great for a NAS or an 8tb internal drive as well.In order to open it, I recommend using a SIM card (the original credit card size plastic that comes with the SIM card) and use 2-3 of them to release the tabs.  By starting at the edge where the power/data port is, you should be able to work your way down the sides until you get to the opposite edge.  Then focus on a corner and it should open without breaking the tabs.
title: Cheap 8tb NAS drive

author: A. Z.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2020
review_content: Works great. The case/enclosure feels Like flimsy plastic. I worry if I drop it, it’s going to break. Looking at getting a case, for the case! I also have a Toshiba and That one feels a little more solid of a build. But it seems to work fine, so far. Wish they enclosed with it like a rubber bumper to go around the outside for shock protection. I bought it to work with my stereo and it was formatted NTFS, which doesn’t work for a lot of media. But you can go to they’re website and re-format it to FAT32.
title: Good, but worried about it durability

author: Will Lotz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2020
review_content: This thing is EXTREMELY slow when it comes to large download sizes on Windows 10, like modern AAA games off Steam, Origin, Battle.net, etc... the read/write speeds this thing is performing at are very sluggish and extremely inconsistent. Just allocating room for a roughly 45 gb game takes 2 hours or more at write speeds less than 1 mb. On top of that, it is very prone to corrupting files while they're being downloaded, forcing a full reinstall.This drive also has a tendency to crash, and quite often at that. Even attempting to run any CPU intensive activities alongside a large install will eventually cause a crash of whatever software is running the install, halting the download and potentially corrupting files. In my own case, downloading games while playing games on Steam eventually results in a crash of some sort, after which a full restart of my system is necessary before the drive can even be accessed and used properly again.In short, don't buy this if you plan to use it for large data transfers. Either spend more money on something more robust or pony up for an SSD.
title: Terrible write speeds and prone to failure with larger file sizes

author: Corey and Shannon Rippeto
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2020
review_content: I got the 10GB device and it was working fine for a couple of weeks, up until 2 days ago. For 48 hours now, I have been trying to unplug it, let it sit for 30+ seconds, and replug it into each of my 3 USB ports for at least 10 minutes at a time each. The blue light blinks but nothing happens. It no longer shows up in my Files and I have no way to access it. It has become useless.Maybe if it were designed with a power button, this wouldn't be an issue. Not sure how I feel about this concept, to have it turn on automatically upon being plugged in, and to go into hibernation mode after not being used for so long. There clearly is a technical issue with it.I have a lot of valuable data stored on this device, so it would be great if it would start working again. Not sure if this is an issue with the device itself, or just the cord. Perhaps a new, higher quality USB cord would fix it?Until further notice, I am not satisfied.
title: Device not turning on. Can't use it. Not happy.

author: Prime Consumer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2020
review_content: Purchased this for someone who needed a storage system for a lot of pictures and videos. Fantastic product as it is straight-forward productivity- you connect it and that's it. Get to storing your precious data! Would definitely consider making another purchase in the future. Size is great for traveling. Well worth the price. PLEASE NOTE: This review is for those who plan to use this product with a PC/WINDOWS computer.
title: Great

author: Michael Fenton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2020
review_content: I would give it 5 stars because I ran my own PC repair business for years and know that Seagate is a reliable brand. Yet this one was supposed to work with the Xbox One and does not, unless only for media - pictures, music only, no games will go on it, you will be told it is too slow by your Xbox as I was. I'm not sending it back because I had bought a Toshiba 2 TB here on Amazon a few months ago for my laptop that does work with the Xbox(I know because my wife has one on her Xbox One S). So I just switched them and this Seagate is now running fine on my Surface Laptop as an external through a Powered USB hub I also bought via Amazon.
title: Won't work with Xbox One X

author: David G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2019
review_content: In less than a year drive started clicking. I thought someone was in the next room with a typewriter. Called support....did what they suggested but it did not fix the problem. So next step was getting an RMA to return it.....followed their instructions only to be taken to a dead end. Tried to call to get an RMA but that was not possible. Even though I had a case number I constantly was being asked to type in my serial number. Save yourself the grief and get a LaCie or Seagate.
title: Drive is failing and WD support is horrible

author: Dave_Sempai
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020
review_content: Hard drive seems to work as expected, however the case on it is very very thin, it feels like a cheap dollar store toy. i thought it was just packaging but no, its the case. i can 3d print a better case so that isn't much of an issue, but keep it in mind if you don't have a safe way to carry this around.
title: VERY thin case

author: Ally
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
review_content: I’ve had it a month now, only been using it for a couple of weeks primarily for one photography job that I had to work on. Not even a quarter of the memory used and it is now giving an error message and otherwise saying that it doesn’t exist.  And when I click out my entire computer freezes. I have photos on here, whether they still exist or not, I’m hesitant to return it. But what a lot of money to throw down the drain.  Save yourself for the headache, don’t buy this thing.
title: Very disappointed

author: Neil Leisenheimer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2020
review_content: Yep, they definitely cheaped out on the controller on this one.  I got a maximum of 30MB/s write.  I considered this an acceptable risk because I have a desktop, and it would work just as well for my use case to remove the case and put it in my PC, which is what I did.  It's not a bad price for an 8TB brand-name bare drive.  The bare drive is a Seagate Barracuda Compute drive.  When writing large files to the bare drive in my PC, it gets 100 - 200MB/s, usually staying around 175 - 200MB/s.
title: People are right about the horrible write speeds - about 20 - 30MB/s

author: Cristian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019
review_content: it 7.27tb which is decent size lost. comes with all kinds of power connectors. requires both its power supply and the usb cable. i needed something without the power supply requirement. already have a SG 5tb and it was more money per tb and half the size at 4.5tb but it’s easy carry and plug and play. if you need the space get the 8tb, if not it’s better to get the 5tb. Also Super slow max 30mbps. Transfer 1tb and it took 20 hours.
title: this thing is huge and needs extra power. do not buy.

author: Scott A. Jurgens
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2020
review_content: I was running out of space on my Playstation 4 and was advised that this would be a great external drive for storing my games.  I received my hard drive in record time.  The package was more that adequate for this product.  It was very easy to set up with my Playstation 4.  I am pretty happy with this purchase and would suggest to anyone that needs an external drive and not necessarily for gaming purchases.  Great product at a great price.  Thanks.
title: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive Portable HDD

author: Beautifulnah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020
review_content: I've seen a number of questions about write speed. This is for the Expansion 10TB drive and I was getting fairly consistent 230Mb/s which is fast! (USB 3 obviously) Ie about 4-5s per GB. Its also a nice looking drive. One feature that may be of interest is that they ship power plugs for every country. They are clip ons, so if you travel, you'll have the plug necessary for any country. Actual capacity is about 9TB ie lose about 10% of stated size.
title: Excellent write speed

author: Maleisa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2020
review_content: I purchased this in September 2019 and its now March 2020 and the drive starting beeping and is not being recognized by the computer. Took it to repair and they said the drive is damaged and nothing they can do. All my data is now gone. I have work that I need to redo. Extremely disappointed by this and wish I could get my money back. A drive should last more than 6 months especially when no damage was done to it.
title: Died and lost all my data

author: MgM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020
review_content: This is a great little portable back up drive. My wife used to work at Seagate (inspector) overseas where they build these, and she is impressed with this.Mac users, use caution when you buy this. It comes with some (nice) softwares installed that will be wiped when the Mac formats the drive.If you are running Windows, no problem. Its already FAT compatible and won't wipe the software off the drive.
title: Great little device, Mac users cautioned

author: dave
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2020
review_content: I have no reservations about the quality of the Seagate hardware.  Like most computer stuff, the instructions and set up,  are by computer geeks, who understand it all.  The rest of us have to guess.  Did the set up, not sure what if anything I accomplished.  Not sure if I succeeded or when it will back up.  No idea how to go and look at the back up files.  The program needs to give the user more feed back on what has been done.
title: instructions ?

author: Kayla Burnett
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020
review_content: This device malfunctioned after only 2 weeks.  It was not dropped or handled improperly.  I was in the middle of transferring photos from my camera to the device when it suddenly disconnected.  I called the tech support and was on the phone for hours and passed to 3 different people before they told me that it would need to be mailed in.  I had a newborn photoshoot stored on it as well as 100s of travel photos that I didn't have backed up yet.  They asked which were most important to save.  38 days later, I received an e-mail saying they couldn't retrieve any of it.  Then it proceeded to say that the improper handling or dropping of the item was the cause.  I never once dropped it.  I only used it twice, and it broke the second time I did.  Would never ever trust this brand again and definitely do not recommend this product.
title: I lost EVERYTHING

author: S. Lee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020
review_content: There must have been a design change after all the good reviews, because I could not even sufficiently seat the USB connector in the drive due to the access relief hole being too small and inaccurately placed.  Due to tolerances the hole does not completely line up with the internal connector, and the plane of the case is too far away from the drive to fully seat.  Poorly toleranced Junk, NOT what I have come to expect from over 30 years of using exclusively Seagate products..
title: USB connector will not seat due to poorly designed case opening

author: rmcollins3
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2019
review_content: Worked well for a few files, but now it's frozen and won't respond. Said one of my folders was corrupt, although I opened it fine before. Also seems slow in transferring large files.The other problem I have is that the cord is so short it would need to hang from a desktop and wouldn't be able to sit on it or the desk. I added a USB extension cable and it works fine, but add $10 for that. If you're using it with a laptop then it's probably not an issue.
title: Already Frozen, Unresponsive

author: Larry A
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020
review_content: I have been using this drive for about 3 weeks. Has great storage capacity. I am using for a Plex media server and haven't had any issues with it's operation. It was a bit noisy at first sitting on the built in pads so I put down a thin piece of spongy material that came with something else I bought recently and it is very quiet now. Transfers are at a decent speed for a usb drive. Others have posted on longevity issues and as stated I haven't had it long enough to comment in that area.
title: Great storage for my media

author: Julian Knight
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2020
review_content: As silly as it might sound, my biggest complaint is that the white indicator light on the front of the drive blinks incessantly when the device's files are being written or read. Even the act of opening a folder on the drive makes it start to blink, and it's a bright light so this is pretty distracting. I've had to resort to flipping it over or covering the light.Read and write speeds are suitable for my needs (~30 GB transfer in couple mins), and capacity is as advertised. Compared to a 2017 Seagate 1TB drive I have and am happy with, this does feel like a little bit of a downgrade—the drive's case feels like it's made of a very cheap plastic (though sturdy), and feels a bit like a phone case.
title: Blinking light is very annoying, but gets the job done

author: EA Renark
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2019
review_content: It's cheap, and large capacity that's the only thing it has going for it. Transfers are bouncing around USB2 speeds with occasional bursts to 50mbps. I started 3TB copying to it on Sunday and it's Thursday. It's 97% Complete. Direct USB3 Plug, that's atrocious.UPDATE 9/8/19: ok so I purchased two of these drives at the same time, the first one is super slow, but the second one is transferring more like I would have expected. (100 mbps) So I don't know if the first one is like a knock off or damaged or what the deal is. I may try to buy another one to see if it's fast.
title: TO SLOW for working people!

author: Mel Irizarry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2020
review_content: What a disaster of a drive.Here is what SMART is reporting.  Notice there are only 710 hours on the drive.  Should have stuck with WD drives.197 Current_Pending_Sector  0x0012  100  100  000  Old_age  Always  -  24198 Offline_Uncorrectable  0x0010  100  100  000  Old_age  Offline  -  24199 UDMA_CRC_Error_Count  0x003e  200  200  000  Old_age  Always  -  0240 Head_Flying_Hours  0x0000  100  253  000  Old_age  Offline  -  710 (2 64 0)
title: Sector failures and data loss after 1 month of use

author: Wolf
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2020
review_content: I ordered a 5TB HDD I received it the day it was supposed to be here. I have nothing bad to say about the hard drive it’s self. I used to work for Seagate technology in Longmont Colorado I was a security guard and one thing I know is the quality and the workmanship that goes into these products. As a security guard I had access to every part of the building and I saw every test they put these things through before they are proud to call it a sea gate product they don’t cut any corners when it comes to testing these things in a variety of situations. I can’t go into any details due to the confidentiality clause I signed but I have no problems with dropping $130 for a 5 TB HDD that I have seen what it goes through before it gets the seagate logo put on it. The only complaint I have is the cable that came with my HDD was defective luckily I have several of them so it wasn’ta big issue for me personally. If you are looking for a solid HDD or SSD that has been put through its paces look no further that Seagate!
title: Good product lack luster cable

author: Austin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2020
review_content: I got this because i needed additional storage for my PS4, and it works perfectly i just plugged it into the USB port and formatted it and now i have 3 times the storage i did before. I haven't noticed the game being any slower on load time since moving it to the external drive. But my PS4 has the standard HDD, not an SSD. Also a great thing about this is i don't have to download all the updates to two PS4's i just the take the drive to the other PS4 and plug it in.
title: HDD for PS4

author: John Hribar
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2020
review_content: This is my fourth Seagate drive. For the most part I have been very satisfied. I have one velcro'd to the lid of my laptop and use it for a lot of my storage and backups. I did have one of the drives start to act funky. It wouldn't start up when the laptop was turned on. It also was not recognized by Windows Explorer on many occasions. I have had it for some time so I can't complain. I would buy it again.
title: WORKS OK

author: Pricilla Kress
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2020
review_content: This external hard drive does what it's exactly supposed to do- or more so what it is advertised to do. I've been using this 1 TB external hard drive for an estimated 6 months. I use it strictly for my PS4 Slim, and have hardly ever unplugged it from the console except a couple times- which can cause minor issues if you're not careful, so make sure if you do remove the external hard drive that your console (especially if using a PS4) is completely off and NOT on rest mode.Regardless, I never had a dire issue or any negative output from the device, It defiantly is convenient, it's small and I would even say if you are planning to use it for portability- then this is a must have, especially for large files.It was a reasonable price, and worth it.  I would buy again, and is great for whatever needs you shall use it for- whether it's gaming or business or anything in-between.
title: Does what it's Advertised to do.

author: Zitty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2020
review_content: Fast, quiet, all good while it worked. But then, after just three months, it would not turn on anymore... I was able to disassemble it (see YouTube) and remove the hard drive. Bought an external HDD enclosure from Amazon, and it worked fine. Lucky me, no data loss :-)  Then, I bought a second unit of this Seagate external hard drive, and it's DOA :-(  Will not turn on; I will be returning it. Two problems out of two purchases, not a good sign.
title: Died in three months

author: P. Campbell
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2019
review_content: I bought a Seagate portable storage drive to back up the stuff from my old computer AND to (eventually) transfer all flash drives and other outdated tech to. It backed up my files faster and more seamlessly than backing up to Dropbox. I bought a TB, still have lots of room; even with FIVE YEARS of data backed up, including multiple production files for 50+ books (I'm an author/publisher. I'm not talking about media files like Kindle) . Happy Camper.
title: Imagine a flashdrive as a 3.5'x5' bag of holding...

author: AMG77
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2019
review_content: The only external hard drives I've ever purchased are Seagate and Western Digital and both are very good brands.  The case is no different here.  Storage in general has dropped a lot in price because of cloud services and getting 8TB of space (7.27 usable) for such a good price was an easy decision.  The drive is easy to setup, operates quickly (I have not formally tested speeds), and runs quietly.  I have this drive plugged into a USB 3.0 hub and do not notice a difference in performance.Overall, it offers a lot of storage for the price and performs well.  I highly recommend this.
title: Great Storage at a Great Price

author: C. L. Nee
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2020
review_content: I bought 2 of these 12 TB drives in 1 order. They are OK as far as functionality concern. But, when the drives were accessed, both of them make very strange noises, and relatively loud. While I was coping data over from my old drives, my wife sitting in the computer room thought I was cooking porridge, laugh out loud! That's exactly the kind sound they were making. I felt with that kind of noises induced from frictions somewhere inside the drives, they are not going to last long. So I returned both.
title: Drives makes strange noises

author: Frank DeRosa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2020
review_content: It lasted less than two months and just quit working.  I only filled it a quarter of the way, minimal usage, and it just quit.  Luckily Amazon is making good and sending a replacement.  At least I didn't lose any data as this was the back up.  What a piece of junk.
title: Dead after two months.

author: Aria Grayson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020
review_content: I just got this in the mail 10 mins ago..... The Package was cut open , however all the contents are inside. And everything seems to works fine ... The harddrive and the box it came in were fine. and sealed properly. Just the prime package was cut open at the corner.Overall I have used seagate harddrives and products before so I know they work great. And are always reliable. I really needed this extra 2TB so I can store all my videos for my Youtube (@Aria Grayson) & My TikTok (@ArgoGrayson)
title: Package Came Cut Open!

author: Attackjackk
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020
review_content: I own an original PS4 which has always run into the issue of not having enough storage. With some newer games coming out now they are constantly demanding more and more storage space to hold all the files. I got tired of having to constantly delete and redownload games so I bit the bullet and purchased this hard drive. All I can say is I am very pleased with my purchase and I don't regret it once. I am able to download all the games that I play currently and I still have plenty of space left over for new games to come.If you are dealing with the same problem of constantly switching the games over and over. I would strongly recommend you considering purchasing a hard drive.
title: Extra Space Needed

author: samara bahae
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2020
review_content: i am going to return it, I have warrant on it but will never buy again. i transferred so much data only after that the drive started to make sound and now i send it to professional to try to recover my data, they intentionally do so i discovered to make u pay 2000 after that to get your data back, i am sorry and regret buying this drive
title: bad hard drive

author: Paul Dornbusch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020
review_content: . . . If You have Win 10, then must down load new back up software called Seagate Toolkit.  BIG PROBLEM, it only recognize internal hdd, unless the external ones are seagate.  I call B***S***.Who wants that.NOT ME.  DONE with Seagate until they fix that.  I know I can use file history, but it does not recognize the files you have already backed up using seagate dashboard.Backup software will not recognize other makes of hdd, only ones mounted IN computer.
title: Backup software will not recognize other makes of hdd, only ones mounted IN computer.

author: Irishlazz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2019
review_content: So very disappointed.  Suddenly and without warning photos and folders started disappearing.  I lost over 1000 photos (2000 if you count the raw and jpeg separately) to sectors going bad fast.  One evening we couldn't find the folder of pics from the previous weekend.  Next day when I went to catalog the missing numbers there were a couple more folders gone.  Took it to my local experts and even with their forensic tools they were unable to recover my photos.  Very very sad.  A little mad.  I may be changing my mind about cloud back-ups.
title: Drive failure in 7 months

author: Matthew Ojeda
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2020
review_content: When I first bought this I was happy. I needed space for my ps4 and once I saw this was compatible with my ps4 I bought it. Recently we just had an earthquake where I lived and my external hard drive ended up falling off the table(it wasn’t even close to the edge) and disconnected. When trying to reconnect it to the ps4 the device don’t show up to reformat it and when it does show up I get “errors” or “this device no longer works.” Waste of 60$ if it can break just by forcefully being ejected
title: Easily damaged

author: Rose
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 29, 2020
review_content: Seagate does not respect consumer privacy. You should be aware that you will be required to revoke your privacy rights and also to accept advertisements. If you don't do this, you will not be able to register/use the product.Are you prepared to share the data you back up, as well as your online activities, with this company?
title: Consumer Privacy A Major Issue

author: Critic at large
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2020
review_content: Small drive. Does get warm. I tested on a MacBook Pro, tested 160-170MB/sec for large file on new drive. Pretty good.However I intended to use with a Pi 4 and it takes way too much power and cannot work with it. It violates the USB spec. Has to go back.
title: Violates spec. Too much power draw for Pi4

author: Renaissance
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2019
review_content: i guess i've forgot what it's like to work with HDD, but was too cheap to keep buying hi speed internal nvme'sthe peak write speed on this drive was 30MB on a superspeed usb 3 connection. average latency 300ms... slower thanusing hp z8, 64gb 20 coresthe main objective of buying this drive was to do some archival offline processing to rar and aes a few terabytes of files to deduplicate before uploading to google storage and awstaking about 30+ hours to zip 700gb of files, the workload is IO bound, not CPU bound
title: obscenely slow, but dirt cheap enough for slow offline operations

author: D AppMen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020
review_content: Got this to use with my PS4/PS5 gaming console. Just connect with the usb cable, format the drive in the settings menu and it's ready to go.Really happy with the purchase.Will look for an SSD storage in the future.
title: Easy setup and Use

author: Michael Henson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2020
review_content: For those that like to install games, download their favorite shows, or download music. This is good for a while until you need more space.Personally I backed up my entire pc (about 1.2 TBs at the time) and it took about 15-18 hours... Still I got a backup of my pc AND I have a bunch of games and stuff that i don't have to delete at the moment
title: Good backup device

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2020
review_content: A little disappointing. I purchased this to save my files and pics so my hard drive can be reformated due to no internet access. The drive was supposed to be drag and drop no formatting needed. But when I plugged it in it prompted me to start here for mac... and then nothing because it could not connect to the internet. I then tried to format it with another computer but not was unsuccessful with that as well... Not very user friendly for me at this point.  Sooo... Now I have to figure something else out. This puts quite a delay in my plans to have my computer fixed, So I'm not happy about this.
title: NOT drag and drop needs formating and internet access.

author: IsraelGuerra
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2020
review_content: I was initially looking for something that affordable and had a lot of storage for the long run of the device. I saw this 2Tb HDD for an unbeatable price and had to buy it. It was very easy to install onto my Xbox and as soon as I was able to use it I was able to transfer and download any games/ files onto the HDD. Definitely happy and would recommend it for anyone that's dealing with those overrated Cod updates.
title: Perfect for more storage on your Xbox console

author: Jack
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2020
review_content: I have several of these compact external drives. They take up minimal space on my desk, they hold 2 T of music, pictures, videos,  and free up my computer while keeping all of my information private. The fact that I can take them anywhere and share what I want with friends is also a nice feature. So far I've not had problems with accessing whatever I store and trsf speed is fine. Good value.
title: SMALL SIZE WITH LOTS OF STORAGE

author: B. Zh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2020
review_content: For those who have never purchased one of these, there isn't a separate power cable.  This makes it easy to it with you where ever you go and one less thing that would hog precious wall outlets.  You may ask, "Well, that's why power strips exists", but trust me... you can't stick a power strip into another power strip and then stick that on another power strip.  The outlet area is already a mess, and I m not about to turn it into Beirut.
title: Great for Consoles & Laptops

author: The Prof
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020
review_content: I've actually got over a dozen of these little units.  I have various storage sizes and manufacturers, but have found them all to be competent.  Some are USB2 others are USB3, although I've not benchmarked them, they all seem to be about the same speed.  They all work, they are portable and they're cheap enough to buy them by the dozens.  With the price of flash drives dropping so rapidly, I doubt I'll purchase any more of these, but I'm not tossing my old ones.
title: work well for archive

author: Adam Jass
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2020
review_content: I'm using this just as an external back-up solution for photos/videos/documents. For some reason, I couldn't get it to work with an automatic backup from windows. I don't know why, but it is just as likely to be Windows' fault. I just copy over my user folder every few weeks manually. Takes some time, but for the size of the backup, I'm happy. Great amount of space and portability for the price!
title: Is working thus far...

author: Kendra
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2020
review_content: I had just received mine yesterday on 8/15/2020. It was all going smoothly until I started to download games to the hard drive. It would start downloading my PS4 games and then at a specific number all my games would stop downloading. I would pause and restart it and the numbers would disappear and it would just not load into the drive. So now I’m returning it to a UPS store to get a refund. This was very upsetting. I have now ordered a more expensive brand with better reviews to see if that’ll work better.
title: Don’t buy it, total flop. Listen to the reviews always..

author: William Michael
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2020
review_content: I bought 2 of these drives.  I have bought at least four others for myself and my children's' MacBook Pros.  The drives come formatted for PC which is not a problem.  I was able to reformat for a Mac.  The problem was I could not partition the drive.I want to use some of the space for TimeMachine and the rest for general use.  DiskUtility would not let me. That option never became active no matter how I had it formatted. I tried on a brand new MacBook Pro and a 6-year-old MacBook Pro, which I used for other Seagate drives. Since I bought 2 of them, I tried with the second one and the same result.I returned both of them and bought 2 Seagate Backup Plus Slim drives.  I hope these two will do what I want.  I have bought a similar one for my wife's iMac and partitioned that.
title: Not truly Mac compatible because cannot be partitioned

author: David
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020
review_content: My Xbox One only has 500gb storage, and this is exactly what I needed to store more games. All I had to do was go to storage, find the device, and format it to use it for games. It works flawlessly! I know its not as quick as an SSD, but for the price its a really good product and if you want a ton of storage this is definitely the way to go. I only got the 1TB to test it out, but I'll probably buy the upgraded option in the near future so I can store even more games.
title: Perfect for my Xbox One

author: C. Matrasko
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2018
review_content: Excellent drive. Very fast interface. Price was perfect!!!
title: Five Stars

author: nf_able
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2020
review_content: I needed a HDD bucket to serve as a Time Machine backup for my Mac main HDD and external hard drives.  This by no means is my main edit / day-to-day file access.  This is my Walt Disney's head deep freeze storage in the event you know what hits the fan.  I think it'll do well, happy with the cost for the storage amount.Read / Write: ~250mb/s connected to iMac 5k 15,1 USB 3.0 port.
title: Big storage, slim profile, not for speedy transfer

author: Ravi Peiris M.D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2020
review_content: Tech support is N/A. Very small form factor. Easily recognized. Just realize as time passes, even 1 TB becomes small. I use this drive primarily for Windows 10 backup using the free version of Macrium which clones your Windows operating system and applications so that in case of system failure, you can reinstall all of Windows and applications without spending hours reinstalling as in years past. It's analogous to System Restore but infinitely more reliable.
title: Primary Backup

author: Louise
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2020
review_content: i didn't need the tech support as my son was helping me via phone.  I've had other Seagate external drives and used them for photos/movies and such.  Now, I'm using it to back-up my entire computer AND the photos and movies!  My son explained how to sub-divide the drive so I have lots of storage room to use as I need and in such a compact module.  It's great, and I'm using it as my regular back-up.
title: Such a great size for backing-up

author: PutUrDoucsUp
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2019
review_content: My 2TB WD external was getting full and decided to go with Seagate this time since the current gen of WD external drives was getting less than favorable reviews compared to Seagate.The drive initially ran at around 30-50mb/s write speed until I did some tests and converted the drive. I ran a thorough full format and checked for bad sectors with WD's Data Lifeguard Diagnostic software. Took about 12 hours for each. Lastly I converted the drive as GPT and created a new volume as a NTFS with default as the allocation unit size with Window 10's "disk management" utility.Now I am getting around 160-170mb/s write speed. Keeping my old WD external drive in case this dies on me. Will Update if it does die.Pros:- Fast write/read speeds. Getting 170mb/s write speeds instead of the listed 160mb/s.- Much faster wake up from sleep compared to my WD.- 8TB Size.- Came with a modifiable power adapter for various electric plug types.Cons:- Does not run at described write speed out of the box. Needed additional utilities/programs.- Internal Temperature at rest and at operation is a little higher than my old WD by 5 degrees Celsius.- Supplied USB 3.0 cord is short. Got a 6ft USB cord from JSAUX.
title: So Far So Good (8TB)

author: Craig Froehle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2019
review_content: The drive is pretty quick. I transferred a big batch of media files and it averaged over 60MB/sec. Much better than a different drive I tried, which was under 40. It spins up and is accessible nearly immediately upon connection, and no external power is needed. Size-wise, it's pretty typical for a 2.5" spinning platter-based portable drive. The sharp edges and matte black give it a monolithic look. My only negative for this is its proprietary cable...everything should be USB-C now, can we all agree on that?
title: Quick, portable, works well.

author: Jones Family
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
review_content: I had this for not even a month. Had all my work programs and media back ups on it. Then it elected not to work. I lost a lot of information, memories and projects for work. Some items are just not recoverable.Their response...Not their fault, not their problem.They then had the stones to try to SELL me a replacement drive. Exact same model but for a higher price!!!!Worst buy I have ever done. I wouldn’t trust any of their products, even to be used as a doorstop.
title: Get use to disappointment

author: AirCavMechanic
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020
review_content: I originally needed a memory expansion for my PS4 Pro, but their HD's were A) not as much capacity as this one and B) more expensive. It works AMAZINGLY WELL and has never caused a game (both offline and online) to glitch or malfunction.
title: Better for PS4 back up!!!

author: Freddy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2019
review_content: Works great on the Xbox one and easy to set up
title: Xbox one

author: Phillip from SLC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2020
review_content: I bought this external hard drive not only for the quality and capacity but also for the simplicity. It really is just as easy as the instructions say: just drag and drop and you're finished! True, it doesn't have all the nice features of the more sophisticated models in the Seagate line but if you're just looking for something basic you can't go wrong with this one. I connect this one to my HP computer with Windows 10 and haven't had any problems - well worth the money!
title: Excellent portable hard drive!

author: Tharshey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2020
review_content: So I ordered my first hard drive to use as external storage for my PS4. It arrived on the day it said it would and I opened it up and checked it out, it had no signs of damage and I promptly plugged it into my PS4. I chose the format as extended storage option and it worked perfectly, I then moved some of my games over and have used it ever since, no hard drive crash or any problems at all so far.I ordered the second one for storing pictures, videos and movies from my computer. Unlike the last one which arrives on time this one arrived a day early so I was suitably impressed. Anyway I’ve been using it for about a month or so now and it’s going great.Please note from the 2TB, only about 1.81TB is available for you, the rest is system software etc for the hard drive itself. I’ve had no problems so far thou I do treat my hard drives with the utmost care.Would definitely recommend it for anyone needed extra storage space.
title: Works Great Bought A Second One!

author: MnE
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2019
review_content: I got this stickle for ps4! Cheaper then other 4tb but same specs. I connected to ps4, got notification found expandable storage n that its not supported! Next go to ps4 settings then devices then expandable memory, then click menu n select use as expandable memory then walk thru formatting.
