Once formatting is complete about 1-2mins u then can access n store to it! Ive completed 3 files moved so far, no issues. This is a great deal n solid product! Plug n play with ps4 after formatting!
title: Ps4 compatible, easy install/setup

author: R_Garza
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020
review_content: This hard drive has worked out really well as an expansion to my Xbox One. I had seen some hard drives and didn't wan to pull the trigger on them as I didn't want more clutter, but this device is rather small and very light. That being said, I do not see any differences in load times and have not had any issues. It has for sure surpassed my expectations.Would Recommend.
title: Great Little Hard Drive

author: Andreea Burton-Fossum
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2020
review_content: I bought this cause I needed a new 5TB external hard drive. I got my original one from costco and was a little worried about ordering one from amazon since it's a big chunk of money. I shouldn't have worried! This product came on time, in like-new condition, and was right on time. It is palm sized, light weight, functions fast and efficiently, and is easy to use. It was exactly as described and I am 100% satisfied with my purchase. Would buy again!
title: Love this!

author: Arkansas Woman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2020
review_content: This product was dead on arrival. Despite my efforts to contact three people in tech support, the drive would not function. Don't buy this hard drive.
title: Dead on arrival.

author: Gage Miller
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2020
review_content: Got this for my PS4 works fine if you plug it in brand new can’t speak for the people that use it on computers. Hell we had an electrician doing work at the house when I was moving some games onto it he cut the power, I thought my goose was cooked. Once the power came back on I noticed it moved 2/3 of the games I was moving safely and the final 1/3 was going smoothly as well but the damn electrician cut the power again and I thought “Well this guy either is a bad electrician or has 0 regard for people” still turned out fine once the power was back on. Great hard drive
title: It’s a Good Hard Drive

author: Mikey In Buffalo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2020
review_content: Good and tough of Seagate, but disappointed in the speed. Even though it's USB 3.0 (AKA USB 3.1 GEN 1), the drive is a LOT slower to read and write than I expected. I have a different external drive that writes through the same USB 3.0 port at nearly 100 MB/s, but this one can't get about 40-50.When writing for a few minutes (it's a 4 TB, and at that slowness speed, it'll take about 5 hours to fill it up), it gets very warm. I have to stop it, because it's warm enough to worry.
title: Good, but slow and hot

author: Sonoma's Davey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2020
review_content: I bought two of these for rotating my data backups. Very nice feeling to know that my data is safe. My NAS is 16 TB of RAID 6, but I'm using only 2 TB of it so this 8 TB drive easily accommodates everything I have. The plastic housing seems durable enough. I haven''t been very rough with this -- I think the 2.5 inch drives are built to take more physical punishment than the 3.5 inch drives like this one.
title: Backup drive for all my stuff

author: Chara
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2020
review_content: Im happy with my purchase. Only purchased to backup files because I changed my laptop. I think it works well and is easy to travel with. The files transferred quickly. I saw a lot of the low ratings were from gamers and photographers/videographers... but I wasn’t familiar with the tech terms they were using so I wasn’t sure if this would be a good purchase. If you’re not tech savvy and just want a portable drive this works great. The comments can get overwhelming for those of us who aren’t looking for gaming storage.
title: Great purchase

author: Southwest Desert Lover
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2020
review_content: I ordered the 5TB version as I need a lot of storage.  Received it in a brown box that did not appear to be a new Seagate product box.  Looked like it might have been a refurb?  I plugged it into my computer and it showed a total of 561 GB of free space - less than 1/5 of the supposed storage!  I have more available storage still on my laptop.  I have started the return process.  I cannot recommend this product at all!
title: Not 5TB

author: J. Cross
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020
review_content: Purchased this drive 7 months ago.  About a month ago, Windows started reporting about twice a week that the drive needed to be scanned for errors.  Errors were mostly broken links in the directory.  Repairs seemed to be successful at the time.  However, they eventually resulted in files not being readable.  In copying files to a new drive, about 10% of them are unreadable.  Not very good reliability.
title: Drive Failed in 7 months

author: Thinkman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2019
review_content: I have at least 8 of these on different Macs, and have, for the most part, been happy with them. A few have been quirky and would register an error or not even show up on the desktop. Typically Apple's Disk Utility fixed the problems. Still patiently waiting for comparably sized SSDs to come close in price to traditional hard drives.
title: Decent drive

author: Ivan Chu
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2019
review_content: So I got TWO of the 8TB ones in MAY 2019. Now in just 3 months, both of them have the "current pending sector" count error in SMART - causing my files & folders to become corrupted. This is messed up. I've used Seagate for YEARS in the past with their 3-6TB external hard drives. They usually last for at least a year or two. I can't believe these 8TB ones last for less than 3 months. I am going to buy Western Digital from now on and hope their HDDs last longer.
title: WARNING: DO NOT BUY THE 8TB ONE!!!

author: Douglas Wright
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2020
review_content: Great device and very portable.  I was running out of storage space on my MacBook Air and it worked like a charm to move files over and off my primary machine.  Highly recommend.  Also, this hard drive is formatted for Windows, but I followed their easy directions and reformatted it for Mac.
title: Exactly What I Needed

author: The Magnus P
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2020
review_content: Why did I wait so long to buy this?? I'm a PS4 owner and I've wanted to have something like this for about 4 years. Not being tech savvy has scared me away from the purchases. Well I finally did enough research to feel comfortable that I was not getting in over my head and bought this. So easy to set up. Easy to move data from the system to it. Should have had this all along.
title: WHY

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019
review_content: According to the add this hard drive works with both PC and Apple or Mac products. It claims it automatically recognizes the system and then a simple drag and drop. This is no the case at all. For mac or apple the first thing is you have to reformat the drive. This is very aggravating and time consuming. So the add is a total lie which is wrong in so many ways. I do not recommend this product for Mac or apple products. Very disappointed this item. Never will buy again.
title: For apple products you have to first reformat the hard drive.

author: Lesley H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2020
review_content: So far no problems.  It works fast and quiet.  I am even able to edit photos using Lightroom that are located on the drive.  Typically I move photos to edit onto my computer's hard drive as it is a solid state drive connected via SATA, but there have been times where I didn't do that and kept the photos on the Seagate and it has performed well.  Good value, would recommend.
title: Good hard drive

author: 13deadbirds
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2020
review_content: I was surprised at how small this thing is! I’ve been in the process of helping my teenaged son get together a decent gaming setup and this was the perfect addition. It’s even more awesome that this is a pocket-sized hard drive, which makes portability very easy for him and makes it very easy for me to deal with! My son was able to get this set up and running on both our laptop as well as his Xbox with no problems. We are very happy!
title: Small and mighty

author: Jon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2020
review_content: So far so good. Shucked to reveal its a 16TB Exos Enterprise drive. I’ve found it transfers data much faster than advertised. Very good value and much cheaper than buying an EXOS drive without the external enclosure.
title: 16TB is a 7200 RPM EXOS Enterprise drive!

author: JennyD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2020
review_content: I know some love Seagate and others say "blehhh", but I have had many of their hard drives, all the way from 550 GB years ago, to 8 TB today.  I have 3 of the 8's running as we speak.  ALL of these have been running for years and never a problem and that's why I am a fan.  I have tried 2 other brands and both died -- one in 3 yrs and one just after the 2yr warranty, so my still-running Seagate's, after all these years, speaks volumes to me.  I love them!
title: I'm a Seagate fan

author: graveyardgoddess
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2020
review_content: I bought this because I have a 2019 brand new MacBook Air and they don’t have a lot of space to begin with. The product description says it’s comparable you just need to delete a piece of software form the drive. This is FALSE. my computer would not even detect the device. Immediate return.
title: NOT MACBOOK COMPATABLE

author: Alex
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2019
review_content: Expanding on the title, it is a matter of power.  Multiple power supplies result in the same thing:  No life from the drive in any regard.I am currently in communication with Seagate support via email.  Depending on what happens, I will amend the rating I've provided.  However, right now, it's looking like that they would either attempt to repair the failed drive or send a new one, not allowing me to keep the old drive.  I am concerned because (and this something I have fault in), I have date on the drive I have not yet backed up.  I am worried that they will send me a new drive and my data will be lost.  They do offer data recovery through a third-party company; however, it is not included in the warranty.  Please consider these details when deciding on a drive to purchase.Update:  It is the hard case that Seagate will not send me the drive back if they are unable to repair it prior to considering data recovery.  They will instead send me a new one, and my data will be gone.  So, I don't have the option of trying to get it repaired (which is covered under warranty), and data recovery costs just under $800.  Why can't they send me the bad drive back if they can't repair it?  Why *must* they send me a new drive?
title: Drive failed within three months in perfect conditions.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2020
review_content: Received drive in plastic packaging in cardboard box, as other customer images show. Appears to have been repackaged - I bought the same 2TB Seagate drive some time ago and it came in proper packaging. Appearance of enclosure itself looks and feels cheaper. Don't know if things have changed, but the cheaper appearance makes me worry about how drive will hold up.The real kicker is that I bought this for my PS4, but when I tried hooking it up it wasn't compatible. PS4 requires an external drive to be connected, between 250GB-8TB, and be USB 3.0. Only thing I can think of is it that the included cord was not USB 3.0 as advertised. I tried a different cord, and it worked, but I'm extremely disappointed that the included cord was not 3.0 compatible, and I would have been more disappointed had I not had a different cord to use, and wouldn't have been able to use the drive at all.I am usually forgiving but when I order something I expect the advertised product, which I feel this failed to deliver.
title: Not as described. Not USB 3.0

author: Ddy3smptr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2020
review_content: Purchased for Xbox and works out of the box with no problems so far. For my teenage son who takes it with him to friends houses with his controller so physical size is good and portability seems to be there. We'll see how it holds up to a teenage boy over time. I personally stick to Seagate or WD for hard drives as I've just had the best luck with them and my purchase generally depends on which one is less expensive for the specs I'm looking for at the time.
title: Good hard drive

author: Raul Moreno
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020
review_content: Confié ciegamente en este disco duro externo por ser "una marca reconocida". Le he metido alrededor de 300 GB de información, fotos y videos.Después de 3 semanas, apenas 4 usos, el disco duro externo Seagate ya no pudo leerlo ninguna computadora ni laptop.Lo envié a la fábrica de Seagate, sólo para que me respondieran: "no pudimos recuperar ninguno de sus archivos".Simple y sencillamente se eliminaron todos mis archivos, fotos y videos desde el 2005 hasta el 2020.Se eliminaron como si nada muchos buenos recuerdos de mi vida, y Seagate no te soluciona nada. Alrededor de 30,000 fotos desaparecieron de la nada.Te recomiendo NO COMPRAR UN DISCO DURO EXTERNO DE SEAGATE. Busca mejor comprar de otra marca.La peor decisión de mi vida fue comprar este disco duro externo y confiar ciegamente en Seagate.
title: No recomiendo comprarlo

author: Zach
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2020
review_content: When I got the drive, I wondered if it had issues...but after partitions and installations, I found this drive to simply be slow. In comparison to my other items, VERY slow. I have owned a number of WD external drives and M2s, SanDisk SSDs and SDs, and various USB flash. This is the only drive to install this slow  - currently installing a game at 3.6 MB/s (my M2 and SSDs are usually around 90). It's not my ports on my brand new 2020 laptop, nor is it my gigabit internet connection. I expected SOME speed issues with a USB external hard drive for the price point, but at this point I'll likely use it merely to store pictures, documents, etc.If speed isn't an issue for you, or you want more of a backup device, the space and the price are great. If you intend on using the drive frequently for installations of games to take between devices, or large programs, maybe look elsewhere for better write speeds.
title: Slowest drive I've owned

author: Michael
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2019
review_content: For the first day or two when I could put files on this, it mostly crashed on me, saying things like "File Not Found" or your typical "Not Responding" message.After trying to format the disk like it says you're supposed to for the dozenth time now...I'm just going to return it, and get my money back.To be fair, it looks like my experience isn't the norm, but I've been trying to fix this issue from the basis of "What am I doing wrong" rather than being lazy and just blaming the product.After troubleshooting everything I can, I think I just got a faulty product.The capacity is tremendous, so can't knock it there, and it's basically the size of a wallet, so portability is aces.It just won't do the one thing I spend over $100 for it to do, which is store my data and allow me to access it.
title: Doesn't format, won't "safely remove", can't read any files on it.

author: Nikita Podobulkin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2020
review_content: speed write - 140 mB/sspeed read - 120 mB/sbut, I bought two HDD. One of them had a defective wire through which it was written to disk at a speed of only 25 mB/s the packaging is not original, but the main thing is that the content is worthy of the manufacturer's name. I have been buying a Segate for a long time and ... somehow these disks became even faster than the previous 5000100it's too early to talk about reliability. at work all day. Previous segate HDD worked flawlessly.
title: More better

author: Dustin S Bales
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2020
review_content: I picked up the 8tb for backing up full images from my computer. This is a great little hard drive. No it's not a SAS drive with 15k rpm write speeds. It's a simple 5200 rpm 8tb drive for backing up large projects and computer. The casing does appear to be pretty cheap but you could probably rip all of that out of there and  use a SATA cable or HDD dock if you know what you're doing. It's served it's job perfectly for keeping backups of my backups. If you're looking for storage, look no further! If you want an active disk that you'll be reading off of in real time, you'd be better off with an SSD or SAS for the read/write speeds.
title: Great hard drive

author: Pearl Earring
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2020
review_content: Sure SSD's are faster, but they're also far more expensive. This tiny external HDD is a full 2TB of storage that is absolutely perfect for archiving huge files like videos. It's light weight and did not require any additional drivers. And I'm not sure if this is my imagination, but it seems to run a LOT cooler than my 1TB external SSD.This is a no-brainer, BUY IT!
title: Great external drive for archiving

author: vazquez9013
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020
review_content: Got this as extra storage for my PS4 games, it connected pretty easily, it took quite a while to transfer the memory from my games on my PS4 to this external drive but definitely worth it. If you're having trouble connecting it or transferring your current data to it, just google it. Super easy, I can't remember the actual video but you'll come across quite a few that are short and to the point to help you get this set up if you don't know already.
title: Does what it needs to do

author: Maya
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2020
review_content: This is a great storage option rather than storing everything on your computer/laptop. It is not very heavy which is nice if you are trying to travel with it on you, it is also discreet, you would not be able to tell if it was for storage or a charger if you did not know the difference. Overall, great product and would definitely recommend to friends and family members. My boyfriend has one as well and he loves it.
title: As much storage as I will ever need

author: Allison K. Lehenbauer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2020
review_content: I was recommended this product for its usefulness and storage capacity. I do film editing which requires a ton of memory and it is common to suddenly have things crash. I used this product for 2 weeks when it suddenly stopped workIng. Not only could my computer not see the hard drive, though I formatted it ex-phat, I couldn’t use it and get it to work with any computer other than a PC. It is unusual to have access to a PC. I’m a Mac owner. I still have time consuming work on it that I don’t have access to which I had to completely re-do. The hard drive was supposed to replace another hard drive that regularly has problems.
title: Waste of too much money

author: M. H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2019
review_content: There's 3 different Seagate 8TB external drives available - but the other two types use a backup-quality drive (meant to be written once, and very slow to rewrite) while this one uses a Seagate Barracuda ST8000DM004 desktop-quality drive (meant to be USED repeatedly).  Bonus - right now you get the 8TB Barracuda drive installed in a USB3 external housing with wall wart and cable for $10 LESS than the bare drive sells for - plus you can pull the drive out of the USB housing and install it internally without loss of data - a true done right deal !!!
title: Best External HDD - with a REAL Desktop Drive Inside.  Done Right Deal !!

author: Mike
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
review_content: It came in a generic cardboard box which I thought was strange. It works great on my Xbox one. Just be sure that you correctly format the drive when you initially plug it in. If you pick the wrong option you will only be able to save videos but there is a way to reformat it. Just play around with it if that happens. Works great for my Xbox one though. I just wish the packaging was nicer.
title: Works for Xbox One

author: Charles E. Hutnick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2020
review_content: The drive was very easy to set up and start using.  I have a PC with Windows 10. there was nothing to do except plu the drive in and start transferring data.With 1TB of storage I'll have as much space as I need for the pictures of my grandkids.I really can't write about the tech support because I had no need to use them.It normally stays connected to my PC for extra storage but I'm pretty sure if I had to take it to another place it would be simple.Transfer rate seems pretty good, at least as far as I can tell.
title: Easy set up

author: Daniel Brown
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2019
review_content: I use external hard drives quite a bit for my work and use Seagate exclusively at this point. I ordered this drive because I needed a budget option to create a bootable back up drive that would be around 750gb of data. The product arrived on time. I was able to write the back up in about 14 hours using USB 2.0 because that is limitation of the laptop I was backing up. I'm sure it would have been finished much faster if I had been able to take advantage of USB 3.0. I have an older of version of this same drive and was surprised how much lighter this new drive is.
title: Lightweight, Good Capacity. Trustworthy Brand.

author: J.C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
review_content: After taking the plunge and buying a external hard drive for my computer I was more than ready to jump at this purchase for my son. He wanted it for his PS4 and amazingly (let's face it he is 16, sometimes everything has some negative in his mind), I have not heard anything but positive comments from him. The hard drive is easy to use with the system and he is very happy to be able to store games somewhere other than the internal hard drive, as is my husband.
title: Son & Husband Agree

author: Amanda
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2020
review_content: The instructions and user guide seem not to have been included? The only instuctions are an image that how how to connect the cord... could have figured that one out, thanks seagate... the info I really needed was for MAC reformat. And I just googled it, followed the instructions really easily, and it's working on my mac now. If you have a mac and this item doesnt work right away, just do the same, it should work.
title: Websearch instructions for mac reformat

author: Peter E. Olson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2020
review_content: I bought 2 of them at once, as I back up everything every day, one on day one and two two.  Both failed after one month.  All my back up data is lost, as neither can even be mounted. I don't how I return broken hard drives each with 3TB of sensitive and private information.  I'll find out.
title: Double Failure

author: Anthony
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2020
review_content: The cord should be fused to the 'portable hard drive', because if you lose that specialized input cord, you'll never have a replacement for it in that format. They should have made it a USB to USB input or USB to USB type C even would have been fine.If you buy this, I would suggest super gluing the cord into its socket so you never ever lose it. Because you won't be able to access the contents if you do lose the cord. I will be doing something along these lines.
title: Specialized cord input? Hassle.
